content.content: その島へ船便があるか
Is there a steamer service to the island?
船便で送る
to send by steamer
船便のあり次第に品物を送る
I shall send the goods by the next steamer that sails―by the first available ship.
ちょうどに大島へ船便があったからこれに便乗した
I took passage in a steamer which happened to be bound for Oshima.

ふなべり〔船縁〕
〈名〉The gunwale, the bulwark (of a ship or a boat)

ふなまち〔船待ち〕
〈名〉Waiting for a ship:(=する) to wait for a ship to sail

ふなやど〔船宿〕
〈名〉
1. (=船問屋)a shipping agent
2. (=遊船宿)a riverside tea-house (devoted to the letting of pleasure-boats)

content:
ふなゆさん〔船遊山〕
〈名〉Boating:(=する) to go out on the water

content.content: 一座は船遊山をしている
The company is on the water.

content:
ふなよい〔船酔い〕
〈名〉Seasickness

content.content: 船酔いは地を踏むとたちまち直る
When you are seasick, you feel well as soon as you set foot on land.

content:
ふなれ〔不慣〕
〈形〉Unused (to something); unaccustomed (to something); inexperienced (in something)

content.content: 私は授業には不慣れです
I am not accustomed to teaching―I have no experience in teaching.

content:
ふなわたし〔舟渡し〕
〈名〉A ferry

content.content: 舟渡しを渡る
to cross a ferry
舟渡し賃
ferriage

content:
ぶなん〔無難〕
〈形〉
1. (=危難無き)safe; secure

content.content: 無難に山を越した
He crossed the mountains in safety.
事は無難に進んだ
The matter proceeded without a hitch―without let or hindrance.
僕は無難にすんだ
I escaped unhurt―escaped skin-whole―got off with a whole skin―got off without a scratch―came off unscathed.

content: 2. (=非難なき)free from reproach; blameless; passable

content.content: あの人なら無難だろう
He my pass.

content:
ふにあい〔不似合い〕
〈形〉Unbecoming (dress); ill-matched (couple)

content.content: その着物は不似合いだ
Your coat does not become you.
不似合いな夫婦だ
They are an ill-matched couple.
道具が座敷に不似合いだ
The furniture is not in keeping with the room.

content:
ふにく〔腐肉〕
〈名〉Carrion

content.content: 鳶や烏は腐肉を食す
Kites and crows feed on carrion.

content:
ふにょい〔不如意〕
〈名〉
1. (=意の如くならざる)vexatious

content.content: 世の中は不如意なことが多い
Life is full of vexations.
彼は不如意なことがあると暴れ出す
If anything goes wrong with him, he will break out into excesses.
僕は不如意なことだらけだ
Everything goes wrong with me―Everything goes against me.

content: 2. (=暮らしが困難)(to be) in straitened circumstances; in narrow circumstances

content.content: 彼は決して生活が不如意なわけではない
He is by no means in straitened circumstances.
手もと不如意
I am pressed for money―hard up (for money).

ふにん〔不妊〕
〈名〉Sterility:(=の) sterile, barren (woman)

content:
ふにん〔赴任〕
〈名〉Departure for one's new post:(=する) to leave for one's new post; to proceed to one's new post

content.content: 氏は某県知事に任ぜられ近々赴任のはず
He has been appointed governor of xxx prefecture, and leaves for his post shortly.
赴任地
one's new post

content:
ぶにん〔無人〕
〈形〉Wanting in hands; short of hands; short-handed

content.content: 無人で出かけられない
I can not go out, as I have no one to leave in charge of the house.

content:
ふにんか〔不認可〕
〈名〉Disapproval; rejection; a veto:(=する) to disapprove (a bill); to reject (a bill); to veto (a proposal); to put a veto on (a proposal)

content.content: 不認可になる
to be disapproved―rejected―vetoed

ふにんしょう〔不妊症〕
〈名〉Sterility:(=の) sterile, barren (woman)

content:
ふにんじょう〔不人情〕
〈形〉Unfeeling; heartless; cold-hearted; hard-hearted; inhuman; pitiless; unkind

content.content: あんな不人情な奴はありゃしない
No one can be more heartless.

content:
ぶにんそう〔不人相〕
〈形〉Ill-favoured; plain; homely

content.content: 娘は不人相で貰い手が無い
She is so plain that no one will marry her.

ふにんち〔赴任地〕
〈名〉One's new post

content:
ふね〔船、舟〕
〈名〉A ship:(小舟)a boat:(汽船)a steamer:(大和船)a junk:(何船)(such and such)a vessel; (such and such) craft(は単複共同形)

content.content: 船に乗る
sail in a ship―(小舟になら)―ride in a boat―(船乗りになるの意味なら)―go to sea―(乗船するの意味なら)―embark (for America)―take ship (for Shanghai)
船に乗り込む
to go on board (a ship)―(小舟なら)―get into a boat
君は船に乗ったことがあるか
Have you ever sailed in a ship?―Have you ever been at sea?
乗りかけた船だ
I have gone too far to retreat.
船で行く、船で来る
to come or go by ship―by steamer―by sea―by water
あの船で来た
I came in that ship―on that ship.
船で海を渡る
to sail across the sea
舟で河を下る
to go down a river in a boat―sail down a river
神戸までは汽車、それから船で上海へ行く
I shall go by rail as far as Kobe, and then take ship for Shanghai.
船では何をして遊ぶか
How do you amuse yourselves on board ship?
船で生まれる者がある
Some people are born at sea.
船が走る
A ship sails.
舟をこぐ
to row a boat―pull an oar
船が出帆する
A ship sails―A ship sets sail―A ship clears―A steamer leaves.
君の船はいつ出帆か
When does your ship sail?―When do you sail?
あの船は出帆準備をしている
The ship is getting under way―They are getting under way.
船が出る、船を出す
A ship puts to sea―One puts to sea―(小舟なら)―A boat puts off―One pushes off.
波が高くて舟が出せない
The sea is too high to put off.
船が走り出した
The ship is under way―We are under way.
船を沖へ出す、船が沖へ出る
The ship stands out to sea―One stands out to sea.
船が岸へ寄る
The ship stands in for the shore―One stands in for the shore.
海上で船が現れる
A ship comes in sight―A ship heaves in sight.
船が見える
A ship is in sight―Sail ho!
船が航海している
The ship is at sea.
船が入港している
The ship is in port.
入港中の船と航海中の船
ships in port and ships at sea
船が入港する
A ship puts into port.
船が(どこへ)寄港する
A ship puts in at a port―puts in at Hongkong―touches at Hongkong―stops at Hongkong.
船が着く
A ship arrives in port―One arrives in port.
船が着いた
The boat is in―(船中の人が言えば)―Here we are (at Yokohama).
船から上がる
to land (at Yokohama)―(一時なら)―go on shore
船が暴風雨に逢った
The ship was overtaken by a storm―We encountered a storm at sea.
船が揺れる
A ship rolls and pitches―(横になら)―A ship rolls―(縦になら)―A ship pitches.
船が波にもてあそばれる
A ship is tossed about by the sea.
船を乗り捨てる
to abandon a ship to her fate
船が沈む
A ship sinks―A ship goes down―A ship goes to the bottom.
船が破船する
A ship is wrecked.
船を撃沈する
to sink a ship
船を轟沈する
to torpedo a ship
船に酔う
to get seasick
君は船に酔うか
Do you get seasick?―Are you a good sailor?
僕は船には強い
I am a good sailor.
僕は船に弱くて困る
I am a bad sailor―a poor sailor―a fair weather sailor.
船に慣れないと足がふらつく
One not accustomed to the sea have unsteady legs.
船に慣れると足がふらつかなくなる
One gets sea-legs on.
船を雇う
to charter a steamer―(小舟なら)―take (a) boat
船を操縦する
to work a ship
この船を操縦するには何人かかるか
How many men does it take to work this ship?
船を扱う
to take charge of a ship
あの船は誰が扱っているか
Who is in charge of that ship?―Who is captain of that ship?
船を造る
to build a ship
船は建造中
The ship is building―The ship is in course of construction―The ship is under construction―The ship is on the stocks.
船の建造に着手する
to lay down a ship
船を修繕する
to repair a ship
船は修繕中
The ship is under repairs.
船は修繕のため香港に寄港した
The ship put in at Hongkong for repairs.
その船は日本に来ている
The ship is in Japanese waters.
その船は支那へ行っている
The ship is in Chinese waters.
海国の民は船を愛す
A maritime people takes kindly to the sea.
船のことは船頭にまかせよ
No talking to the man at the wheel!
船頭多くして船山へ登る
“Too many cooks spoil the broth.”
渡りに舟
That's the very thing―just the thing―the thing.

content:
ふね〔船、舟〕
〈名〉A ship:(小舟)a boat:(汽船)a steamer:(大和船)a junk:(何船)(such and such)a vessel; (such and such) craft(は単複共同形)

渡りに舟

ふね〔槽〕
〈名〉A cistern; a tank; a trough

content:
ふねっしん〔不熱心〕
〈名〉Want of zeal; want of enthusiasm; want of earnestness:(=な) unenthusiastic (man); lukewarm (man of the world); languid (worker); indifferent (attitude); half-hearted (endeavour, etc.)

content.content: 彼は学問に不熱心だ
He is not earnest in his studies―He is indifferent to learning―He sits loose to his studies.
教員は授業に不熱心だ
The teachers have no heart for their work.
不熱心な信者だ
He is a lukewarm Christian.
彼は政治に対して不熱心な態度をとっている
He shows a languid attitude―an indifferent attitude―towards politics.
不熱心な賛成は賛成せぬに劣る
Half-hearted support is worse than no support.

ふねっしんか〔不熱心家〕
〈名〉A lukewarm man; a Laodicean (in religion or politics)

ふねんせい〔不燃性〕
〈名〉Incombustibility:(=の) incombustible

content:
ふのう〔不納〕
〈名〉Default

content.content: 不納者
a defaulter

content:
ふのう〔不能〕
〈名〉
1. (=不可能)impossibility
2. (=無能力)incompetence; incapacity

content.content: 生殖不能
impotence

content: 3. (=弱点)one's weak point

content.content: 人各々能不能あり
Each man has his strong and weak points―Each man has his limitations.

ふのう〔浮嚢〕
〈名〉(=魚の浮嚢)The sound, the swim, the swimming bladder (of a fish)

ふのり〔布海苔〕
〈名〉Vegetable glue (prepared from a seaweed, the pearl-moss)

content:
ふはい〔腐敗〕
〈名〉
1. (=物質の腐敗)putrefaction; decomposition; decay; taint:(=する) to putrefy; to decompose; to decay; to taint; to rot; to go bad; to turn sour:(=した) putrefied, putrid, decomposed, decayed, rotten (matter); tainted (meat); addled (eggs)

content.content: 暑いと魚はじきに腐敗する
Fish will readily taint in hot weather.
牛乳が腐敗する
Milk turns sour.
漬物が腐敗した
The pickles have gone bad.
死体が腐敗している
The body is decayed―decomposed―putrefied.
卵が腐敗している
The eggs are rotten―addled―spoilt.
肉が腐敗している
The flesh is putrid―(食用肉なら)―The meat is tainted.
魚が腐敗している
The fish is tainted―stale.
腐敗しやすき貨物
perishable goods―perishables
塩は腐敗を防ぐ
Salt preserves things from decay.

content: 2. (=精神の腐敗)Corruption; taint:(=する) to become corrupt:(=せる) corrupt

content.content: 世は腐敗している
The world is corrupt―Society is corrupt.
人心が腐敗している
The people are corrupt.
風儀が腐敗している
Manners are corrupt.
道徳の腐敗は社会の上下にわたらん
The moral taint will spread over all classes.

ふばいどうめい〔不買同盟〕
〈名〉Boycott

ふはいどめ〔腐敗止め〕
〈名〉An antiseptic; an aseptic; a preservative

ふはいぶつ〔腐敗物〕
〈名〉Putrefied things; rotten things; putrid matter

content:
ふはく〔浮薄〕
〈名〉Frivolity, levity (of manner); irreverence (of mind); flippancy (of speech); infidelity (of conduct):(=な) frivolous (manner); irreverent (mind); flippant (way of speaking); faithless (conduct); frothy (literature, etc.)

content.content: 人情浮薄
The people are frivolous.
人情は浮薄に流れやすい
The people are apt to become frivolous.
世は浮薄になって宗教心が無くなる
The world is becoming irreverent and irreligious.
浮薄な弁舌を弄す
to use flippant language―talk flippantly
浮薄な文学を喜ぶ者が多い
Many delight in frothy literature.

content:
ふはつ〔不発〕
〈名〉Missing fire

content.content: はて不思議だ、この銃の不発は無いことだ
Strange! I never knew this gun miss fire.

content:
ふばつ〔不抜〕
〈形〉Indomitable; invincible; unconquerable; steadfast; firm

content.content: 不抜の精神
an indomitable spirit
堅忍不抜
indomitable perseverance
確乎不抜
to be firm and unshaken in one's purpose
確乎不抜の志
a firm purpose―a steadfast purpose

content:
ぶばった〔武張った〕
〈形〉Warlike; military; martial

content.content: あの人は武張った様子をしている
He has a military appearance.
武張ったことが好きだ
He has warlike tastes―martial tastes.

content:
ふはらい〔不払い〕
〈名〉Non-payment

content.content: 不払い手形
a dishonoured note

content:
ふばらい〔賦払い〕
〈名〉Payment by instalments

content.content: 月賦払い
payment by monthly instalments
年賦払い
payment by yearly instalments
賦払い払込金
an instalment
賦払い制度
instalment system―payment system
賦払い売りをする
to sell on the instalment system―sell on the payment system

content:
ぶばらい〔賦払い〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ふばらい〔賦払い〕

content:
ふび〔不備〕
〈名〉
1. (=物事の備わらぬこと)defectiveness; imperfection; incompleteness; omission; lack; want

content.content: 交通機関不備のため旅行は困難だ
Travelling is difficult owing to lack of means of conveyance―owing to imperfect means of conveyance.
不備の点
a defect―an omission
不備の点は第二版において補足すべし
Any omissions will be rectified in the second edition.
証文に不備の点がある
The bond is not all right.

content: 2. (=準備無きこと)unpreparedness

content.content: 敵の不備に乗ずる
to take advantage of the unprepared state of the enemy―take the enemy at a disadvantage―take the enemy at vantage

content:
ぶび〔武備〕
〈名〉
1. (=軍備)preparation for war; military preparations; defences; armaments:(米国にては)preparedness

content.content: 武備を厳にする
to strengthen the defences
武備を撒する、武備を解く
disarm a ship―dismantle a fortress

content: 2. (=武芸)the use of arms

content.content: 文事有る者は必ず武備有り
He who is versed in letters, is always skilled in the use of arms.

ぶびき〔歩引き〕
〈名〉A discount:(=する) to discount; to make a discount

content:
ふひつよう〔不必要〕
〈形〉Unnecessary

content.content: この金は当分不必要だ(無くてすむ)
This money is unnecessary to me for the present―(を通例)―I can do without this money for the present.
あの人はまったく不必要だ(いなくとも結構間に合う)
He is quite unnecessary to the school―(を通例)―He can be very well done without.

content:
ふひょう〔浮漂〕
〈形〉Floating; drifting

content.content: 浮漂植物
a floating plant

ふひょう〔浮評〕
〈名〉A groundless rumour; a false rumour

content:
ふひょうばん〔不評判〕
〈名〉Disrepute; discredit; disfavour; unpopularity:(=な) disreputable; discreditable; unpopular

content.content: 今度の知事は不評判だ
The new governor is unpopular.
彼はどうして不評判になったか
How did he become unpopular?―fall into disrepute?―fall into discredit?―fall into disfavour―(他動詞構文にすれば)―What made him unpopular?―What brought him into disrepute?―into discredit?―into disfavour?

content:
ふびん〔不憫〕
〈形〉Pitiable; to be pitied:(=がる) to take pity on, feel pity for, commiserate, compassionate (the unfortunate)

content.content: この子は不憫なものさ
The child is to be pitied―Poor child!
不憫と思う
to take pity on―feel pity for―one
なにとぞ不憫とおぼしめせ
Please take pity on me!
不憫とおぼしめし彼女をお助け下さい
For pity's sake, save her!
あのような女はどんな不幸に陥っても人が不憫と思わぬ
People take no pity on―feel no pity for―such women.

content:
ふひんこう〔不品行〕
〈名〉Misconduct; irregularity in conduct; loose conduct; loose morals; a loose life:(=な) ill-conducted; irregular; immoral; loose in morals

content.content: あの人は不品行だ
He is ill-conducted―irregular in conduct―loose in morals―a loose liver―a loose fish―a sad dog.
不品行をする
to misconduct oneself―live a loose life
彼は不品行をして退校を命ぜられた
He has been expelled from school for irregularity.

content:
ぶふうりゅう〔無風流〕
〈形〉Unpoetical, unromantic, prosaic, Philistine (life); unrefined, vulgar (manner); wanting in taste

content.content: 無風流な男だね
What a Philistine you are!
松島を
Matsushima past
蒸気で走る
To steam so fast―
無風流
What lack of taste!

content:
ふぶき〔吹雪〕
〈名〉A snow-storm; a blizzard

content.content: 山中で吹雪に逢った
We were overtaken by a blizzard while in the mountains.

content:
ふふく〔不服〕
〈名〉
1. (=不平)dissatisfaction

content.content: 僕はこの裁判には不服だ
I am dissatisfied with the decision.
判決に不服を申立てる
to declare one's dissatisfaction with the decision
裁判に不服なら控訴するがよい
If you are dissatisfied with the decision, you ought to appeal.

content: 2. (=反対)a protest; a remonstrance

content.content: 処置に不服を唱える
to protest against―remonstrate against―the measure
処置に不服を申立てる
to enter a protest against the measure

content: 3. (=叛心)disaffection (towards the government)

content.content: その頃政府に対して不服を懐いている者があった
Some people were disaffected―ill-affected―towards the government―There were some malcontents.

content:
ぶぶん〔部分〕
〈名〉A part; a portion; a section; a division

content.content: この習慣は日本の一部分に留まる
This custom is limited to a part of the country.
彼は財産の一部分をこの事業に投じた
He devoted a portion of his fortune to the enterprise.
市区改正になったのは市の一部分だけだ
The improvement is limited to a section of the city.

ぶぶんしょく〔部分蝕〕
〈名〉A partial eclipse (of the moon)

ぶぶんてき〔部分的〕
〈形〉Partial (success); sectional (attack, etc.)

content:
ふぶんめい〔不分明〕
〈形〉Indistinct (pronunciation); obscure (meaning); unknown (origin, etc.)

content.content: 文中不分明の点あり
There are some obscure points in the text.
所在不分明
His whereabouts is unknown.

ふぶんりつ〔不文律〕
〈名〉An unwritten law; the common law (of England)

content:
ふへい〔不平〕
〈名〉Discontent, dissatisfaction (with anything); disaffection (towards the government):(普通名詞に用いれば)a complaint; a grievance:(=な) discontented, dissatisfied, aggrieved, wronged, injured (man or mind or air); disaffected, ill-affected, malcontent (subject):(米国にては) disgruntled

content.content: 僕は不平がある
I am dissatisfied―I have a grievance.
待遇が不平だ
I am dissatisfied with my treatment.
彼は厭世家で何を見ても不平なのだ
He is a misanthrope, and dissatisfied with everything.
公平に扱ってくれないから不平だ
They deny me justice―I have justice denied me.
不平の無いようにしてやる
I will do you justice―have justice done you.
不平を言う、不平を鳴らす
to complain (of something)―fret
彼は待遇が悪いとて不平を鳴らしている
He complains of unhandsome treatment.
君は何か不平でもあるのか
Have you anything to complain of?―Are you dissatisfied with anything?
僕は何も不平は無い
I have nothing to complain of―I am quite contented.
彼らは苦しいとか辛いとか何とかかとか不平ばかり言っている
They do nothing but complain of the strain, hardships, and what not.
ありもせぬ不平を言うている
They complain of fancied wrongs.
蔭で不平を言う
to murmur (at something)
(新校長が改革を始めると)蔭で不平を言う者があった
Some people murmured at his proceedings.
不平の声が聞こえる
Murmurs are heard.
不平を漏らす
to grumble (at anything)
給料が少ないと言って不平を漏らす者がある
Some grumble at scanty pay.
不平なら一つ漏さない
Not a complaint ever escapes his lips.
不平を並べ立てる
to air one's grievances
不平を懐く
to cherish a grievance―feel oneself aggrieved―labour under a sense of wrong―be dissatisfied―be discontented
彼は待遇について不平を懐いている
He is dissatisfied with his treatment.
その頃政府に対して不平を懐いている者があった
Some people were disaffected―ill-affected―towards the government.
彼らは長官に対して不平を懐いている
They have a grievance against their chief.
不平で辞職する
to resign in disgust
彼は不平らしい顔をしてすわっている
He sits with an injured air.
不平らしい声でそう言った
He said so in an injured tone.

ふへいか〔不平家〕
〈名〉A grumbler; a fretter; a malcontent

ふへいきん〔不平均〕
〈名〉Inequality; disproportion:(=な) unequal; disproportioned; disproportionate

content:
ふへいづら〔不平面〕
〈名〉A discontented look; an aggrieved look; an injured air; a disgruntled air; a sour face

content.content: 彼は不平面をしている
He looks discontented.
不平面をしてすわっている
He sits with an injured air.

ふへいとう〔不平党〕
〈集名〉The malcontents

ふへいや〔不平屋〕
〈名〉A habitual fretter

content:
ぶべつ〔侮蔑〕
〈名〉Contempt:(=する) to contemn; to despise

content.content: 言下の侮蔑
a sweeping condemnation

ふへん〔不変〕
〈形〉Unchangeable; immutable; invariable; permanent; constant; uniform; steady

content:
ふへん〔普遍〕
〈名〉Universality; ubiquity; omnipresence:(=なる) universal; ubiquitous; omnipresent

content.content: 神は普遍なり
God is omnipresent.

content:
ふべん〔不便〕
〈名〉Inconvenience:(=な) inconvenient (place); incommodious (house); inexpedient (means); unwieldy (weapon); unhandy (volume, etc.)

content.content: この辺は電車が無くて不便だ
It is inconvenient to live in these parts, so far from the cars.
和服は働くに不便だ
Japanese clothes are inconvenient to work in.
不便を感ずる
to feel the inconvenience
痛切に不便を感ずる
The inconvenience is keenly felt.
不便を感ぜしむ
to inconvenience―incommode―discommode―one
僕がいなくて不便を生ずるような事はないか
Won't my absence cause any inconvenience?―Shall I not be missed?
これは使いにくい不便な家だ
This is an incommodious house.
この本は大部で携帯に不便だ
The book is bulky and unhandy to carry about.
なぜそんな不便な方法を取るのか
Why resort to such inexpedient means?

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 交通の不便
difficulty of communication
この土地は交通が不便だ
This place is difficult of communication―difficult of access.

content:
ふべんきょう〔不勉強〕
〈名〉Want of diligence; want of industry:(=な) not diligent; not industrious

content.content: 彼は平素不勉強だ
He does not work hard at the best of times.

content:
ふべんぜつ〔不弁舌〕
〈形〉Ineloquent

content.content: 不弁舌なる口上をもって申上げます
Excuse my want of eloquence.

content:
ふへんふとう〔不偏不党〕
〈形〉Impartial; unbiassed; non-partisan

content.content: 不偏不党の新聞
a non-partisan paper

content:
ふぼ〔父母〕
〈名〉(One's) father and mother, parents

content.content: よく父母につかえる
to be dutiful to one's parents
身体髪膚之を父母に受く、敢て毀傷せざるは孝の始めなり
This body of mine have I received for my parents, and to keep it safe from harm is my first filial duty.

content:
ふほう〔不法〕
〈形〉Unlawful (act); illegal (proceeding); lawless (person); false (imprisonment)

content.content: 不法なことをする
to act unlawfully
不法行為
an unlawful act
不法の処置に反対を唱える
to protest against illegal proceedings
不法監禁
false imprisonment
不法な死刑
judicial murder
不法侵入
trespass

content:
ふほう〔訃報〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ふいん〔訃音〕

content:
ふほんいながら〔不本意乍ら〕
〈副〉Against one's will; with reluctance

content.content: それでは不本意ながら訴えなければならぬ
Then I shall be obliged, though much against my will, to proceed against you.
はなはだ不本意ながらこの処置をとりました
I have had to take this step with great reluctance.

content:
ぶま〔無間〕
〈名〉A stupid blunder; an awkward blunder:(=な) awkward; clumsy; stupid

content.content: 無間をやる、無間なことをする
to commit a stupid blunder―bungle―make a mess of it
無間なことをしたもんだ
What a blunder he has committed!

content:
ふまじめ〔不真面目〕
〈形〉Wanting in earnestness; insincere; gay; frivolous

content.content: 彼は不まじめで困る
He is wanting in earnestness.
不まじめな国民は大国民になれぬ
An insincere people can not make a great nation.
不まじめな商売
a gay trade―a frivolous business

content:
ふまん〔不満〕
〈名〉Displeasure; discontent

content.content: 彼の仕打を不満に思う
I am displeased at his conduct.
彼はその返事を聞いて不満な顔をした
He looked displeased at the answer.
不満を懐く
to harbour a discontented mood―harbour a vexed mood

content:
ふまんぞく〔不満足〕
〈名〉Dissatisfaction; discontent

content.content: 待遇が不満足だ
I am discontented with my treatment.
その答弁では不満足だ
I am dissatisfied with your answer.
彼は今の位置が不満足らしい
He seems to be discontented with his present position.
その取りきめに不満足を表わした
I expressed my dissatisfaction with the arrangement.

content:
ふみ〔不味〕
〈形〉
1. (=うまくない)bad to the taste; unpalatable
2. (=商況の不味)dull; slack; stagnant

content.content: 商況不味
Business is slack―Trade is dull―The market is stagnant.

content:
ふみ〔文〕
〈名〉
1. (=手紙)a letter:(殊に痴話文)a love-letter

content.content: 文はやりたし
I fain would write to one I love,
書く手は持たず
But that no hand to write I have.

content: 2. (=書物)a book (especially in poetry)

content.content: いにしえの
Whene'er I open peruse
文見るたびに思うかな
The chronicles of old,
己が治むる
I ask: How fares it with the land
国はいかにと
Whereof the rein I hold?

content:
ふみあらす〔踏み荒す〕
〈他動〉To trample down

content.content: 演習で田畑をさんざんに踏み荒らされた
Owing to the manoeuvres, the fields were badly trampled down.

content:
ふみいし〔踏石〕
〈名〉Stepping-stones (in a garden)

content.content: 踏石伝いに行く
to walk over the stepping-stones

ふみいた〔踏板〕
〈名〉(楽器の踏板)a pedal:(ふいごなどの踏板)a treadle

content:
ふみいる〔踏入る〕
〈自動〉To step in; to step into (a place)

content.content: 大陸へ足を踏入る
to gain a footing on the continent
悪所へ足を踏入る
to set foot in bad quarters

ふみえ〔踏絵〕
〈名〉A picture of the crucifix (which the old-time people had to tread upon in proof that they were not Christians)

ふみかえる〔踏換える〕
〈自動〉To change step; to shift from one foot to the other

ふみかためる〔踏固める〕
〈他動〉To tread down (the ground)

content:
ふみきり〔踏切り〕
〈名〉A crossing; a railway-crossing

content.content: 踏切りを通る時は汽車に注意せよ
When you pass a crossing, look out for a train.
踏切り番人
a crossing-keeper

content:
ふみきる〔踏切る〕
〈他動〉
1. To cross (a track)

content.content: 線路を踏切る道がある
A path crosses the track―runs across the track.
その家は線路を踏切ったところだ
The house stands across the track.
土俵を踏切る
to step over the edge of the ring

ふみくだく〔踏砕く〕
〈他動〉To trample (anything) to pieces

ふみぐるま〔踏車〕
〈名〉The treadmill

ふみけす〔踏消す〕
〈他動〉To stamp out, tread out (the fire)

content:
ふみこたえ〔踏みこたえ〕
〈名〉Tenacity; endurance:(=る) to endure; to hold out

content.content: 日本人は踏みこたえが無い
The Japanese lack tenacity.
土俵際で踏みこたえる
to make a stand on the edge of the ring

content:
ふみこむ〔踏込む〕
〈自他動〉To dash in; to raid

content.content: 巡査はその家へ踏込んで犯人を捕縛した
A policeman dashed into the house, and arrested the culprit.
巡査がばくち宿へ踏込んだ
The police raided―made a raid upon―a gambling-den.
巡査に踏込まれた
The premises were raided by policemen.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 人の地面へ足を踏込む
to trespass on another's ground
人の領分へ足を踏込む
to encroach on another's province
悪所へ足を踏込む
to set foot in bad quarters

content:
ふみごむ〔踏込む〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: ふみこむ〔踏込む〕

ふみころす〔踏殺す〕
〈他動〉To trample (one) to death

content:
ふみしめる〔踏締める〕
〈自動〉To steady oneself

content.content: 足を踏みしめて氷を渡った
I steadied myself over the ice.

content:
ふみだい〔踏台〕
〈名〉
1. (=乗るもの)a block, a stool, a chair (to get on)

content.content: 踏台が無ければ届かない
You can't reach it without getting on a chair.
人を踏台にする
to get on a man's shoulder
乗馬用の踏台
a horse-block

content: 2. (=踏石)a stepping-stone

content.content: この島を取っておけば大陸への踏台になる
This island will serve as a stepping-stone to the continent.

content:
ふみたおす〔踏倒す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=払うべき金を払わぬ)to evade (payment); to repudiate (a debt); to bilk (a creditor or his bill); to do (a bill)

content.content: 借金を踏倒す
to bilk a bill―do a bill

content: 2. (=ひどく値切る)to beat down (the price)

ふみだす〔踏出す〕
〈自動〉To step out; to step forward; to start

content.content: 海外へ踏み出す
to tread on foreign soil
海外へは一歩も踏出したことが無い
I never set foot on foreign soil―I have never been outside the country.

content:
ふみだん〔踏段〕
〈名〉A step; a stair

content.content: 電車の踏段
the footboard

content:
ふみちがえる〔踏み違える〕
〈自動〉To tread wrong; to tread amiss; to tread awry; to take a false step

content.content: ちょっと踏み違えるとたいへんだ
A single false step would be fatal.
正道を踏み違える
to err from the right path―stray from the path of right

ふみつぎ〔踏継ぎ〕
〈名〉A stool (to get on)

content:
ふみつける〔踏付ける〕
〈他動〉To trample on (the grass); to trample (the grass) down; to tread on (something dirty); to step on (a snake, etc.)

content.content: 何だか汚ない物を踏みつけた
I have trodden on something dirty.
偉い人が倒れると皆で踏みつける
If a great man once fall, all will tread upon him.
人を踏みつけた仕打だ
He has trampled on my feelings―walked over my feelings―gallopped over my feelings.
人の権利を踏みつける(蹂躪する)
to trample one's rights under foot
人倫道徳を踏みつける
to outrage morality

ふみつぶす〔踏潰す〕
〈他動〉To crush (anything) with one's feet

content:
ふみとどまる〔踏留まる〕
〈自動〉To hold one's ground; to stand one's ground; to make a stand

content.content: 我が兵は勇敢に踏みとどまって敵を喰い止めた
Our men bravely stood their ground―made a gallant stand―and checked the enemy.

content:
ふみならす〔踏均らす〕
〈他動〉To tread down (the ground); to beat (a path)

content.content: 踏みならした路
a beaten path―the beaten track

content:
ふみにじる〔踏躪る〕
〈他動〉To trample upon, tread upon (the flowers); to trample (the flowers) under foot; to tread (the flowers) under foot

content.content: 人の権利を踏みにじる
to trample one's rights under foot

content:
ふみぬき〔踏抜き〕
〈名〉An injury to the sole of the foot caused by treading on a sharp point

content.content: 踏抜きをする
to hurt one's foot by treading on something sharp

ふみぬく〔踏抜く〕
〈自動〉To tread on something sharp; to run a nail into one's foot

content:
ふみはずす〔踏外す〕
〈他動〉To miss one's footing

content.content: 足を踏はずす
to miss one's footing―lose one's footing―make a false step
梯子段を踏はずす
to miss one's footing on the stairs
あぶみを踏はずす
to miss one's stirrups
正道を踏はずす
to err from the right path―stray from the path of right

content:
ふみまよう〔踏迷う〕
〈自動〉To stray; to go astray:(より) to stray ［err, wander］ from the right path; to fall into error

content.content: 人たる道を踏迷う
to err from the path of duty―stray from the path of duty―wander from the path of duty
恋の闇路に踏迷う
to lose oneself in the maze of love
智者も学者も踏迷う
The wisest lose themselves in this maze.

content:
ふみもち〔不身持〕
〈名〉Misconduct; loose conduct; loose morals; a loose life

content.content: 彼は不身持で困る
He is loose in morals―a loose fish―a sad dog.
彼は不身持が直らないで困る
He will not mend his ways―amend (his conduct)―reform (himself).
不身持が直った
He has mended his ways―amended (his conduct)―reformed (himself)―turned over a new leaf.
坊主の不身持
“It is a good divine who follows his own instructions.”

ふみわら〔踏藁〕
〈名〉(=馬の踏藁)Litter

content:
ふみんしょう〔不眠症〕
〈名〉Insomnia

content.content: 僕は不眠症にかかっている
I am suffering from insomnia―troubled with insomnia.

content:
ふむ〔践む〕
〈他動〉
1. To put (a doctrine) in practice

content.content: 信ずるところを実際にふむ
to live up to one's faith
決心をふむ
to act up to one's resolution
位をふむ
to ascend the Throne

content:
ふむ〔踏む〕
〈他動〉
1. To tread (the earth―on the ground); to trample (grass―on grass); to step on (stones); to set foot on (land)

content.content: 地を踏む
to tread the earth―tread on the ground―set foot on land
船酔いは地を踏むとたちまち直る
When you are seasick, you feel well as soon as you set foot on land.
僕は外国の地を踏んだことが無い
I never set foot on foreign soil.
日本の地を初めて踏んだ英国人は Adams
Adams was the first Englishman that ever set foot on Japan's soil.
彼ら如き者に日本の土だに踏ませるのはもったいない
It is not for them to set foot on Japan's sacred soil.
芝を踏む
to walk over the lawn
芝生を踏むべからず
Keep off the grass.
雲踏む心地
I felt as if I were treading on air.
薄氷を踏むよう
I feel as if I were treading on eggs.
虎の尾を踏む心地
I feel as if I were treading on a tiger's tail.
あぶみを踏む
to rest one's feet in the stirrups
あぶみを踏んで立つ
to stand in one's stirrups
人の足を踏む
to tread on one's toes
座敷が散らかっていて足の踏みどころも無い
The room is so littered that I can not find a spot to tread on―a spot to step on.
手の舞い足の踏むところを知らず
I am transported with joy―in a transport of joy.
路を踏む
to tread a path―walk a path
安全な道を踏む、危険な道を踏む
to tread a safe path―tread a perilous path
正道を踏む
to tread the path of right
地道を踏む
to tread the right path―walk the right path―follow the beaten track―tread one's shoes straight
人たるの道を踏む
to walk the path of duty
誰のわだちを踏む
to follow in the wake of some one
こういう人のわだちを踏むな
Do not follow in the wake of such men!
覆轍を踏む
to follow in the wake of those who have failed
舞台を踏む
to tread the boards―walk the stage―perform on the stage―appear before the public
檜舞台を踏む
to perform on a first-class stage―appear before the great public
場所を踏む、本場を踏む
to “go through the mill”
道楽場所を踏んだ男だ
He has gone through the mill of fashionable life.
場数を踏む
to have varied practical experience
月を踏む
to walk in the moonlight
霜を踏む
to go out early in the morning
百姓は霜を踏んで出て月を踏んで帰る
The peasant goes out early in the morning and comes home late in the evening.
地団太を踏む
to stamp one's foot―(怒ったなら)―stamp with rage―(悔しがったなら)―stamp with vexation―(はがゆかったなら)―stamp with impatience
相撲がしこを踏む
A wrestler stamps on the ring (preparatory to wrestling).

〈名〉A swing:(=する) to swing

content.content: 子どもらがぶらんこしている
The children are on the swing.
ぶらんこ往生する
(縊死する)to hang oneself―(絞罪になる)―be hanged

content:
ふらんす〔仏蘭西<フランス>〕
〈固名〉France:(=の) French

content.content: フランス人
a Frenchman―(女は)―a Frenchwoman―(総称すれば)―the French
フランス語
(the) French (language)
フランス語で水のことを何と言う
What is the French for “water”?
フランス革命
the French Revolution

content:
ふらんす〔仏蘭西<フランス>〕
〈固名〉France:(=の) French

content.content: フランス人
a Frenchman―(女は)―a Frenchwoman―(総称すれば)―the French
フランス語
(the) French (language)
フランス語で水のことを何と言う
What is the French for “water”?
フランス革命
the French Revolution

ぶらんぶらんする
〈自動〉To dangle; to be flipperty-flopperty

content:
ふり〔降り〕
〈名〉A rainfall

content.content: たいした降りにもなるまい
It won't be much of a fall.
大降り
a heavy rainfall―a downpour
長降り
a long rain
小降りになった
There is a lull (in the rain).

content:
ふり〔振り〕
〈名〉
1. (=偽りの真似)pretence; feint; sham:(=する) to pretend (to do something); to profess (to be something); to make believe (that one does something); to feign (something); to sham (something); to make a feint (of doing something); to make as if (one were doing something)

content.content: 彼は何でも知った振りをする
He pretends to know everything.
知らぬふりをしている
He pretends not to know―makes believe that he does not know―feigns ignorance.
見ぬふりをする
to pretend not to see―take no notice of a person―wink at a fault―connive at an offence
彼は見ないふりして通り過ぎた
He passed by me without taking notice of me.
些細なあやまちは見て見ぬふりがよい
It is best to wink at petty faults.
聞こえぬふりをする
to pretend not to hear―take no notice of a remark
死んだふりをふる
to pretend to be dead―make believe that one is dead―feign death―sham death―play possum
寝たふりをする
to pretend to be asleep―make believe that one is asleep―feign sleep―sham sleep―play possum
病気のふりをする
to pretend to be ill―feign illness―sham illness―sham Abraham―(陸海軍では)―malinger
喉を突くふりをした
He made a feint of cutting his throat.
逃げるふりをした
He made as if he were going to run away.
彼は親切なふりをして僕をだました
He cheated me under pretence of friendship―under colour of friendship―under the mask of friendship.

content: 2. (=うわべ)simulation; dissimulation:(=する) to dissemble; to simulate; to dissimulate

content.content: 怖がるふりをする
to dissemble fear―simulate fear
怖くないふりをする
to dissemble courage―simulate courage―dissimulate fear

content: 3. (=風)manner; manners

content.content: 人のふり見て我がふり直せ
Correct your manners by seeing other's faults.
彼は形{なり}にもふりにも構わない
He is careless about his personal appearance.

content: 〈助数詞〉

content.content: 太刀一振り、二振り
one sword―two swords

content: 〈形〉Casual; chance

content.content: (常客に対し)ふりの客
a casual guest―a chance customer―a stranger
手前どもではふりのお客を上げません
We do not serve strangers.

content:
ふり〔不利〕
〈名〉Disadvantage; handicap; drawback:(=の) disadvantageous (to one); unfavourable (to one); against (one)

content.content: 不利の位置に立つ
to stand in a disadvantageous position
事情が事情だから自然不利の位置に立たねばならぬ
Circumstances handicap me―I am handicapped by circumstances.
不利の裁判
an unfavourable decision
裁判官が原告に不利の判決をした
The judge gave decision unfavourable to the plaintiff―decided against the plaintiff.
不利の証拠
unfavourable evidence
こちらに不利の証拠は無い
There is no evidence against us.
被告に不利の証言をする
to testify against the prisoner―bear witness against the prisoner
形勢不利
Appearances are against me.
裁判はこちらに不利だった
The decision went against me.
文明にも不利の点がある
Civilization has its drawbacks.

content:
ぶり〔振り〕
〈接尾詞〉(=風)way; manner

content.content: 歩きぶり
one's manner of walking―walk―gait―pace―step―tread
あの人は遠くから歩きぶりでわかる
I know him a mile off by his walk―by his gait.
話しぶり
one's way of talking
あの話しぶりでは何でも知っていそうだ
By the way he talks, one would think he know everything―To hear him talk, one would think he knew everything―He talks as if he knew everything.
遊びぶり
one's way of taking one's pleasure
人は遊びぶりでわかる
A man is known by the way he takes his pleasure―Pleasure shows a man as he is.
働きぶり
(武者ぶりの意味なら)behaviour―(功労の意味なら)―services
働きぶりする
to exaggerate one's services
あっぱれな働きぶり
He has acquitted himself to his credit.
思わせぶり
coquetry
思わせぶりする
to play the coquette
男ぶり、女ぶり
one's looks―good looks
男ぶりが好い
He is good-looking.
女ぶりが上がった
She has improved in her looks.
(年をとっても)女ぶりが下がらぬ
She keeps (in) her good looks.
女ぶりが下がった
She has lost her good looks.
盆栽は木ぶりを賞す
A dwarf-tree is prized for its grace and elegance.
この木は枝ぶりが好い
This tree has graceful branches.
楓は葉ぶりが好い
The maple has a beautiful foliage.
この鳥は羽ぶりが好い
This bird has a beautiful plumage.
あの男は羽振りが好い
He is influential―prosperous―in high feather.
あの人は亭主ぶりが好い
He plays the host well―hosts it well.
お客様ぶりが好い
He plays the guest well―guests it well.
彼は大臣ぶりはどうか
How does he play the minister?―minister it?
今度の先生は教員ぶりが好い
The new man plays the teacher well―teachers it well.
あの女は花嫁ぶりはさぞ好かろう
How well she must play the bride!―bride it!
老人ぶりが好い、老人ぶりが悪い
He wears his age well―wears his years ill.
出世ぶりが好い、出世ぶりが悪い
He wears his fortune well―wears his honours ill.
営業ぶり
one's business method
大ぶり
large-sized
小ぶり
small-sized―undersized

content:
〈前置詞相当〉
1. (=分)for (so many)

content.content: ご馳走は三人ぶりある
There are eatables for three (persons).
二日ぶりの楽
medicine for two days

content: 2. (=経って)after

content.content: 十年ぶりで帰省した
I am home after ten years' absence.
五年ぶりで両親に会った
I saw my parents after five years' absence―after five years' separation.
兄から三年ぶりで便りがあった
I have heard from my brother after three years' silence.
昨日は二年ぶりで動物園へ行ってみた
I visited the Zoo yesterday after a neglect of two years.
今日は一年ぶりで酒を飲んだ
I have drunk today after a year's abstinence.
今日は一週間ぶりで湯に入った
I have washed away a week's dirt.
ひと月ぶりで頭髪を刈った
I have cut a month's growth of hair.
お久し振りです
I have not seen you for an age―You are quite a stranger.

content:
ふりあい〔振合い〕
〈名〉Relation

content.content: 他の振合い
relative importance
他の振合いもありましょうが、これだけではよろしいように思われます
I don't know how it stands to the others in relative importance, but, considered in itself, it seems all right.
世間の振合いも考えなければならぬ
We must have regard to custom.

content:
ふりあう〔振り合う〕
〈名〉To wave together

content.content: 袖振り合うも他生の縁
Even a chance acquaintance is a divine ordinance.

ふりあげる〔振上げる〕
〈他動〉To throw up, fling up, swing up (one's hands, etc.)

content:
ふりうり〔振売り〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ふれうり〔触れ売り〕

content:
ふりえき〔不利益〕
〈名〉Disadvantage; drawback; handicap:(=な) disadvantageous (to one); unfavourable (to one); against (one)

content.content: 不利益の位置に立つ
to stand in a disadvantageous position
西洋人は何をするにも不利益だ
A foreigner is at a disadvantage in doing anything―A foreigner labours under a disadvantage in doing anything.
不利益な裁判
an unfavourable decision
裁判官が原告に不利益な判決をした
The judge gave decision unfavourable to the plaintiff―decided against the plaintiff.
不利益な証拠
unfavourable evidence
こちらに不利益な証拠は無い
There is no evidence against me.
被告に不利益な証言をする
to testify against the prisoner―bear witness against the prisoner
僕は彼に不利益なことは何も知らぬ
I know nothing against him.
そんなことをするとかえって君のために不利益だ
You are acting, not for, but against your own interests.
そんな議論はかえって君のために不利益だ
Such arguments make, not for, but against your own interests.
延引するだけこちらの不利益だ
Time is against us.
事情が事情だから自然不利益の地位に立たねばならぬ
Circumstances handicap me―I am handicapped by circumstances.
文明にも不利益な点がある
Civilization has its drawbacks.

content:
ふりおとす〔振落す〕
〈他動〉To shake off; to throw off

content.content: 馬が人をふり落とす
A horse throws his rider―spills his rider.

content:
ふりかえ〔振替〕
〈名〉Change (of a bill); transfer (of savings):(=る) to change (a bill); to transfer (savings)

content.content: 振替取引
a transfer transaction
振替伝票
a transfer-slip
振替勘定
a transfer accounts

ぶりかえし〔振返し〕
〈名〉A relapse

content:
ぶりかえす〔振返す〕
〈自動〉To relapse into illness; to have a relapse

content.content: 気をつけないとぶりかえすよ
Have a care, or you will have a relapse.

content:
ふりかえちょきん〔振替貯金〕
〈名〉Savings; transfer account

content.content: 振替貯金口座東京千二百番
P. O. Savings Transfer Account N.1200 Tokyo.

content:
ふりかえる〔振返る〕
〈自動〉To turn round; to look round; to look back; to look over one's shoulder

content.content: 名を呼ばれて振返って見た
Hearing myself called by name, I turned round―looked round.
彼が通ると女どもが振返って見る
When he passes along the streets, the girls looks back at him.

content:
ふりかかる〔降懸かる〕
〈他動〉To hang over (one); to impend over (one); to befall (one); to happen to (one)

content.content: 君の身に大難がふりかかっている
A great danger hangs over your head―impends over your head.
彼は身にふりかかる不幸などを物ともせぬ
He makes nothing of the misfortune that happens to him―befalls him―falls on him.

ふりかける〔振掛ける〕
〈他動〉To sprinkle (pepper on or over meat―meat with pepper, etc.)

ふりかざす〔振翳す〕
〈他動〉To brandish (a sword) over one's head

content:
ふりかた〔振方〕
〈名〉Disposal

content.content: 身の振り方
how to dispose of oneself―what to do with oneself
身の振り方をつける
to dispose of oneself
彼女は身の振り方に困っている
She does not know what to do with herself.
身の振り方について相談を受けた
She asked my advice as to how she should dispose of herself.

content:
ふりがな〔振仮名〕
〈名〉Japanese syllabaries attached to Chinese characters (as a help to read the latter)

content.content: 新聞はふりがながついている
The newspapers have Japanese syllabaries attached to Chinese characters.

content:
ぶりき〔鉄葉<ブリキ>〕
〈名〉Tin-plate

content.content: ブリキ細工
tinware
ブリキ屋
a tin-smith―a tinman―a tinner―a whitesmith
ブリキの缶
(英国にては)a tin―(米国にては)―a can

content:
ぶりき〔鉄葉<ブリキ>〕
〈名〉Tin-plate

content.content: ブリキ細工
tinware
ブリキ屋
a tin-smith―a tinman―a tinner―a whitesmith
ブリキの缶
(英国にては)a tin―(米国にては)―a can

ふりきる〔振切る〕
〈他動〉To shake off (some appendage)

content:
ふりこ〔振子〕
〈名〉A pendulum

content.content: 振子が振る
A pendulum swings.

content:
ふりこう〔不履行〕
〈名〉Non-performance; non-fulfilment; default

content.content: 義務の不履行
non-performance of an obligation
契約の不履行
non-fulfilment of an agreement
彼は契約不履行だ
He is in default―He is a defaulter.

content:
ふりこむ〔降込む〕
〈自動〉To rain in; to rain into (the house)

content.content: 雨が降り込む
The rain blows in.

content:
ふりこめられる〔降籠められる〕
〈受動〉To be kept indoors by rain

content.content: 当節は雨に降りこめられて少しも出ない
The rain keeps me indoors these days.
雨に降りこめられて戸の口からちょっとも出られぬ
There is no stirring an inch out of doors.
雪に降りこめられる
to be snowed in―snowed up―(汽車なら)―snow-bound

content:
ふりしきる〔降りしきる〕
〈自動〉To rain hard

content.content: 雨が降りしきっている
It is raining hard―raining its hardest―raining cats and dogs.
雪が降りしきる
Snow falls thick and fast.
雪は卍巴と降りしきる
The snowflakes dance and whirl.

content:
ふりすてる〔振捨てる〕
〈他動〉To abandon; discard; give over; fling over (a girl)

content.content: (西洋では)女が男を振捨てる
A girl gives a lover over―flings a lover over―jilts a lover.
女が男を振捨てて他の男に乗り換える
A girl jilts one lover for another.

content:
ふりそで〔振袖〕
〈名〉Long sleeves; a long-sleeved gown

content.content: 振袖着て仕事はできぬ
“A cat in gloves catches no mice.”

content:
ふりだし〔振出し〕
〈名〉
1. (=薬の振出し)the infusion (of a drug)
2. (=賽の振出し)the first throw (of dice)

content.content: 彼は振出しが小学校の教員であった
He started in life as―began life as―a primary school teacher.

content: 3. (=手形の振出し)the drawing (of a bill); the issue (of a cheque)

content.content: 振り出し人
the drawer (of a bill)―the issuer (of a cheque)
振出し地
the place of drawing―the place of issue
振出局
the office of issue
振出銀行
the bank of issue
振出手形
a deposit certificate

ふりだしぐすり〔振出し薬〕
〈名〉An infusion; the infusion of a drug

content:
ふりだす〔降り出す〕
〈自動〉To begin raining

content.content: 今にも降り出しそうだ
It threatens to rain at any moment.
雪がちらちら降り出した
It is beginning to snow―Snowflakes have begun to flit in the air.

content:
ふりだす〔振出す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=薬を振出す)to infuse (a drug)

content.content: 薬を湯で振出す
to infuse a drug in hot water

content: 2. (=手形を振出す)to draw (a bill); to issue (a cheque)

content.content: 誰あての手形を振出す
to draw a bill upon some one
誰あてにいくらの手形を振出す
to draw upon some one for a sum
俺にあてて手形を振出して要るだけ金を取れ
You may draw upon me for any sum you may need.
小切手を振出す
to issue a cheque
田中あてに千円の小切手を振出した
I have issued a cheque for 1000 yen in favour of Mr. Tanaka.

ふりたてる〔振立てる〕
〈他動〉(頭を)to wag (one's head):(柱を)to set up (a post):(声を)to set up (a cry); to lift up (one's voice)

ふりつ〔府立〕
〈形〉Prefectural (school, hospital, etc.)

ふりはなす〔振放す〕
〈他動〉To shake off (one's hand, etc.)

content:
ふりはらう〔振払う〕
〈他動〉To shake off (dust or snow)

content.content: 着物の塵を振払う
to shake the dust off one's clothes
馬が蠅を振り払う
A horse whisks off the flies.

ぶりぶりおこる〔ぶりぶり怒る〕
〈自動〉To fret and fume

content:
ぷりぷりする〔プリプリする〕
〈自動〉To fret and fume; to be sore (on some subject)

content.content: 彼は損をしてプリプリしている
He is sore on the subject of his loss.

content:
ぷりぷりする〔プリプリする〕
〈自動〉To fret and fume; to be sore (on some subject)

content.content: 彼は損をしてプリプリしている
He is sore on the subject of his loss.

content:
ふりまく〔振撒く〕
〈他動〉To scatter; to sprinkle; to strew; to lavish

content.content: 往来へ水を振りまく
to sprinkle water on the street―sprinkle the street with water
路に花を振りまいて人を歓迎する
to strew one's path with flowers
金を振りまく
to lavish money (on people)
美人が愛嬌をふりまく
She is profuse of her smiles.
誰にでも愛嬌をふりまく
(美人なら)She has a smile for everybody―(男なら)―He has a kind word for everybody.
彼はまんべんなく愛嬌をふりまく(八方美人)
He makes himself universally agreeable―makes himself agreeable to everybody―tries to please everybody.
お世辞をふりまく
He is lavish of compliments.

content:
ふりまわす〔振回す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=振って回す)to brandish (a weapon); to flourish (a sabre); to wield (a sword, etc.)

content.content: 凶漢は短刀を振りまわして追手を近づけぬ
The ruffian brandished a knife, and kept his pursuers at bay.
一人の士官が威勢良く軍刀を振りまわしながら中隊を率いて突撃した
An officer, flourishing his sabre, charged the enemy at the head of his company.
彼はステッキを振りまわして歩く
He flourishes his stick as he goes.
僕にはこの太刀は振りまわしきれぬ
I can not wield this sword.
権力を振りまわす
to wield one's power
彼は拳骨をふりまわして僕を脅かした
He shook his fist at me―shook his fist in my face.

content: 2. (=見せびらかす)to display; to parade; to air

content.content: 学問をふりまわす
to display―parade―make a parade of―make a display of―one's learning
彼は通をふりまわす
He parades his knowledge of the town.
半可通をふりまわす
He airs his smattering knowledge.

content:
ふりみだす〔振乱す〕
〈他動〉To dishevel (one's hair)

content.content: 女が髪をふり乱して駈けて来た
A woman came running with dishevelled hair.

ふりみふらずみ〔降りみ降らずみ〕
〈副〉Now raining, now stopping; raining off and on

content:
ふりむく〔振向く〕
〈自動〉To turn round; to look round

content.content: 名を呼ばれたから振向いて見た
Hearing myself called by name, I turned round―looked round.
彼が通ると皆振向いて見る
Everybody turns round and looks at him when he passes.
あの女は男など振向いては見ない
She will not look at a man.

ふりもぎる〔振りもぎる〕
〈他動〉To shake off (one's hand, etc.)

ふりやむ〔降り止む〕
〈自動〉To stop raining (or snowing)

content:
ふりゅうすいらい〔浮流水雷〕
〈名〉A floating mine

content.content: 浮流水雷を流す
to lay floating-mines
浮流水雷に触れる
to strike a floating mine

content:
ふりょ〔不慮〕
〈形〉Unforeseen; accidental; casual; contingent; emergent

content.content: 不慮の出来事
a contingency―an emergency―an accident
不慮の事変に備える
to provide against emergencies―provide against contingencies―provide against accidents
不慮の災難に逢う
to have a mishap

content:
ふりょ〔浮虜〕
〈名〉A prisoner (of war)

content.content: 浮虜にする
to take one prisoner―take them prisoners
浮虜になる
to be taken prisoner―taken prisoners
浮虜を交換する
to exchange prisoners
浮虜交換
the exchange of prisoners―cartel
浮虜引渡し
the delivery of prisoners
浮虜収容所
an internment camp―the prisoner's quarters
浮虜情報局
the Prisoner's Intelligence Office

ふりょう〔不猟〕
〈名〉
1. (=猟の無いこと)scarcity of game; a poor bag
2. (=不漁)scarcity of fish; a poor catch

content:
ふりょう〔不良〕
〈形〉Bad, wicked, vicious, depraved, ill-conditioned (people); bad, ill, poor (health); bad, inclement (weather); inferior, unsound (goods); unwholesome (food or drink)

content.content: 不良少年
a bad boy―a vicious boy―a depraved boy―a delinquent boy―(総称すれば)―the hooligans
不良の徒
a knave―a rascal―a scoundrel
健康不良
to be in bad health―in ill health―in poor health―out of health
病人は経過不良
The invalid is doing poorly―progressing unfavourably.
天候不良
The weather is bad―The weather is inclement.
成績不良
The results are unsatisfactory.
発育不良
The child is ill-grown.
稲作不良
The rice-crop is light.
不良品
inferior goods―unsound goods
不良飲食物
unwholesome food and drink

ふりょう〔負量〕
〈名〉A negative quantity; a minus quantity

content:
ぶりょう〔無聊〕
〈名〉Tedium; ennui; inaction

content.content: 彼は無聊に苦しんでいる
He is oppressed with tedium―oppressed with ennui―fretting and fuming in inaction―He does not know what to do with himself―He does not know how to dispose of his time―Time hangs heavy on his hands.
無聊を慰む
to relieve the tedium―beguile the tedium―beguile the time―while away the time―kill time
無聊を慰むるには読書
Reading is a good kill-time―a great resource.

content:
ふりょうけん〔不了簡〕
〈名〉A wrong idea; a wrong step; an ill-advised course; a rash step:(=な) wrong; ill-advised; rash

content.content: 不了簡を起こす
to think of doing wrong
(自殺しようなんて)どうしてそんな不了簡なことをしたのか
What made you think of committing such a rash act?

content:
ふりょうしょうねん〔不良少年〕
〈名〉A bad boy; a vicious boy; a depraved boy; a delinquent boy:(総称すれば)the hooligans

content.content: 不良少年を感化する
to reform depraved boys
不良少年狩りをする
to hunt the hooligans

ぶりょうとうげん〔武陵桃源〕
〈名〉A fairyland

ふりょうどうたい〔不良導体〕
〈名〉A non-conductor

content:
ぶりょく〔武力〕
〈名〉Military power; force of arms; the mailed fist; the sword; the sabre

content.content: 武力に訴える
to appeal to arms
武力をもって国を治める
to rule by the sword―by the sabre
武力をもって世を圧する
to oppress the people with the mailed fist―dragoon the people
武力をもって問題を解決する
to settle a question by force of arms―submit a dispute to the arbitrament of war
武力を用いずに問題を解決する
to settle a dispute without an appeal to arms
武力干渉
armed interference

content:
ふりわけ〔振分け〕
〈名〉Carrying before and behind

content.content: 荷物を振分けにする
to carry packages before and behind (with straps over the shoulders)

ふりわけがみ〔振分髪〕
〈名〉(A child's) parted hair

content:
ふりん〔不倫〕
〈名〉Immorality; incest:(=の) immoral; incestuous

content.content: 不倫の行為
an incestuous act
不倫の行為をする
to be guilty of incest

content:
ふる〔経る〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: へる〔経る〕
時を経る
Time passes―Time elapses.
手続きを経る
to go through a process
艱難を経る
to go through hardships

content:
ふる〔古〕
〈接頭詞〉Old; second-hand

content.content: 古で買う
to buy anything (at) second-hand
この本は古で安く買ったけれども新{あら}も同然だ
I bought the book cheap at second-hand, but it is a good as new.
古本
old books―second-hand books
古狸
an old fox―an old one

content:
ふる〔降る〕
〈自動〉
1. To fall

content.content: 雨が降る
Rain falls―It rains.
今年は雨がよく降った
Much rain has fallen―There has been much rain―We have had much rain―this year.
朝焼けがすると雨が降る
The morning glow is a sign of rain.
雨がザーザー降る
The rain pours down―There is a downpour.
雨がパラパラ降る
The rain pelts―The rain patters on the roof.
雨がシトシト降る
It rains in earnest.
大雨が降っている
It is raining cats and dogs.
槍が降っても行く
I will go even if it should rain pitchforks.
まだ降っているか
Is it still raining?
雨が晴れて星が降りそうだ
It has cleared up, and it is raining stars.
雨が降りそうだ
It looks like rain.
今にも降りそうなあやしい空だ
It threatens to rain at any moment.
雨降って地固まる
Rain settles the soil―(より)―“Good comes out of evil.”
降ったり止んだり
It rains off and on.
銃弾が雨にように降る
The bullets come down like rain.
僕は照っても降っても散歩を欠かさない
I make a point of taking a walk in sunshine or in rain―rain or shine―in rain or fine.
雪が降る
Snow falls―It snows.
昨年は雪がたんと降らなかった
Little snow fell―There was little snow―We had little snow―last year.
雪が一尺降った
One foot of snow has fallen.
あそこでは雪が六尺も降る
Snow falls there to a depth of six feet.
雪空だから雪が降りそうだ
From the leaden look of the sky, it looks like snow.
あられが降る、ひょうが降る
It hails―There is a hail-storm.
弾はあられと散る
It hails bullets.
兵は弾丸あられと降る下に冷静に働く
The men behave coolly under a hail of bullets.
霜が降る
It freezes.
昨夜は霜が降った
It froze last night.
血の雨が降った
There was bloodshed.
血の雨を降らす
to shed blood
拳骨の雨を降らせる
to shower blows―hail blows―on one
盃の雨が降るようだ
It rains cups.
彼は天から降ったきたようだ
He has dropped from the clouds.
天から降ったか地から湧いたか
A vision!

content:
ふる〔触る〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: ふれる〔触れる〕
物品に手を触るべからず
The visitor is requested not to touch the articles―(は英、米は)―Hands off

content:
ふる〔振る〕
〈他動〉
1. To shake (one's head); to wave (a flag); to brandish (a sword); to flourish (a sabre); to swing (a club); to sway (one's arms); to wag; whisk, switch (a tail)

content.content: 西洋人がかぶりを振るのは否の意味のほかに不賛成の意味にもなる
A foreigner shakes his head in token of disapproval as well as of denial or refusal.
彼はかぶりを振っていやだと言った
He refused with a shake of the head.
否とかぶりを縦に振る
She says “No” and nods assent.
犬が尾を振る
A dog wags his tail.
犬が尾を振って人を迎える、尾を振って歓喜を表わす
A dog wags you a welcome―wags his joy.
馬が尾を振る
A horse whisks or switches his tail.
馬が尾を振って蠅を払う
A horse whisks off the flies.
旗を振る
to wave a flag
婦人達がハンカチを振る
The ladies wave their handkerchiefs.
群衆が帽子を振って喝采する
The crowd wave their hats and cheer.
日本人が手を横に振って「駄目だ」とか「黙っておれ」とか言う意味が西洋人に通ずるか
Does a foreigner understand, when he sees a Japanese wave his hand from side to side, that it means “No go” or “Mum is the word”?
彼は拳骨を振った僕を脅かした
He shook his fist at me―shook his fist in my face.
彼は手を振って歩く
He swings his arms as he goes.
大手を振って去る(通過する)
to march off in triumph―come off with flying colours
あの人はステッキを振って歩く
He flourishes his stick as he goes.
一人の士官が威勢好く軍刀を振って中隊を率いて突貫した
An officer, flourishing his sabre, charged the enemy at the head of his company.
袖を振る
to wave one's sleeves
無い袖は振られぬ
One can make nothing out of nothing.
鈴を振る
to shake a hand-bell
徳利を振る
to shake a bottle
駕籠屋が尻を振る
A sedan-chair bearer sways his bottom from side to side.
張子の虎が首を振る
A toy-tiger sways its head from side to side.
塩を振る
to sprinkle salt on fish―sprinkle fish with salt
(日本では)塩を振って清める
We sprinkle salt over a spot―(西洋では)―They sprinkle ashes over a spot.
賽を振る
to throw dice―cast dice
漢字に仮名を振る
to add (translations or pronunciations in) Japanese syllabaries to Chinese characters
女が男を振る
A woman refuses a man―rejects a man―jilts a lover―gives him the mitten.
振られた男
a rejected lover
振られて帰る果報者
When Venus does not shine on you, Fortune smiles on you.
資本を棒に振る
to lose one's capital

content: 〈自動〉

content.content: 時計の振子が振る
A pendulum swings or oscillates.

ぶる〔振る〕
〈自動〉
1. (=気取る)to put on airs; to give oneself airs
2. (=高ぶる)to be haughty; to mount the high horse

content:
ぶる〔振る〕
〈接尾動詞〉［注意］始め英語を標準とす。
1. To affect (the character of...)

content.content: 紳士ぶる
to affect the gentleman
学者ぶる
to affect the scholar
哲人ぶる
to affect the philosopher
通人振る
to affect the man of the world
道徳家ぶる
to affect virtue
信心家ぶる
to affect piety

content: 2. To act, play (the part of...)

content.content: お大尽ぶる
to act the lord
豪傑ぶる
to play the hero―heroize
(女に対して)色男ぶる
to play the gallant

content: 3. To set up for, pose as (a certain character)

content.content: 彼は馬車など抱えて紳士ぶっている
He keeps a carriage, and sets up for a gentleman.
道徳家ぶる
to set up for a virtuous man―pose as a man of virtue
学者ぶる
to set up for a scholar―pose as a man of learning
哲人ぶる
to set up for a philosopher―pose as a philosopher
詩人ぶる
to set up for a poet―pose as a poet
批評家ぶる
to set up for a critic
通人ぶる
to set up for a man of the world
色男ぶる
to set up for a beau
高尚ぶる
to pose as a man of lofty ideas

content: 4. To assume, put on, give oneself (some air)

content.content: 長者ぶる
to assume a superior air―put on a patronizing air
(子どもが)おとなぶる
to assume a grown-up air―to be precocious
君子ぶる
to assume a virtuous air
学者ぶる
to assume a learned air
高尚ぶる
to assume a lofty air
お上品振る
to assume a refined air―to be squeamish
尊大ぶる、もったいぶる、容体ぶる
to assume an air of importance―put on a consequential air―give oneself consequence
宗教家ぶる
to assume a pious air
聖人ぶる
to give oneself sanctified airs
権体ぶる
to put on airs―give oneself airs

content: 5. To pretend to, lay claim to (wisdom or virtue)

content.content: 道徳家ぶる
to pretend to virtue
学者ぶる
to pretend to learning
僕は学者ぶるわけではないが
I do not lay claim to scholarship, but...
通人ぶる
to pretend to knowledge of the world
僕は通人ぶるわけじゃないが
I do not lay claim to any knowledge of the world,but...

content: 6. To come (the real or assumed character) over (one)

content.content: 彼は大臣ぶるか
Does he come the minister over you?
伯(叔)父さんぶるわけじゃないが
I don't mean to come the uncle over you, but...
君は批評家ぶるのか
Do you mean to come the critic over me?
老練家ぶる
to come the old soldier over one
殿様ぶって威張る
to domineer over one―lord it over one

content:
7. 
〈以上の共通点〉

content.content: 紳士ぶる
to affect the gentleman―set up for a gentleman
君子ぶる
to pose as a man of virtue―set up for a virtuous man―assume a virtuous air―pretend to virtue―affect virtue
学者ぶる
to affect the scholar―set up for a scholar―pose as a man of learning―assume a learned air―pretend to learning
哲人ぶる
to affect the philosopher―set up for a philosopher―pose as a philosopher
詩人ぶる
to affect the poet―set up for a poet―pose as a poet
通人ぶる
to affect the man of the world―set up for a man about town―pretend to knowledge of the world
色男ぶる
to play the gallant―set up for a beau
高尚ぶる
to assume a lofty air―pose as a man of lofty ideas
信心家ぶる
to affect piety―assume a pious air

content:
ふるい〔古い〕
〈形〉Old (story); ancient (custom); time-honoured (method); stale (joke); antiquated (manners, etc.)

content.content: 古いしゃれだ
It is a stale joke.
古い家柄だ
It is an old family―ancient family.
君に古い借金がある
I owe you a debt of old standing―a debt of long standing.
あの人は頭が古いから駄目だ
He has a superannuated head.
古きを温{たず}ねて新しきを知る
We inquire of the ancients about modern affairs.

content:
ふるい〔震い〕
〈名〉A tremor; shivering; shaking

content.content: 手にふるいが来た
My hands shake.
瘧{おこり}でふるいが来る
Ague brings on a shivering fit.

content:
ふるい〔篩〕
〈名〉A sieve; a bolter

content.content: じゃり篩
a screen―a riddle
篩で篩う
to sieve―sift―bolt―screen―riddle

content:
ぶるい〔部類〕
〈名〉A class; a division; a category; a group; a head

content.content: (何の)部類に入る
to fall under the head of―come under the head of―something
八犬伝は伝奇小説の部類に入る
The “Hakkenden” falls under the head of romances.
(何の)部類に入れる
to classify anything with animals or plants
彼を友人の部類に入れておく
I classify him with my friends.
部類に分ける
to classify things

content:
ふるいあがる〔震い上がる〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: ふるえあがる〔震え上がる〕

ふるいおこす〔振い起こす〕
〈他動詞〉To arouse, awaken (anything dormant)

content:
ふるいおこる〔奮い起こる〕
〈自動〉To rouse oneself; to awaken

content.content: 宗教奮い起こる
There is an awakening of religions.

content:
ふるいけ〔古池〕
〈名〉An old pond

content.content: 古池や
Old garden lake!
蛙飛び込む
The frog thy depths doth seek,
水の音
And sleeping echoes wake.

content:
ふるいごえ〔震い声〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ふるえごえ〔震え声〕

ふるいたつ〔奮い起つ〕
〈自動〉To rouse oneself; to be aroused; to be stirred up

content:
ふるいつく〔震い付く〕
〈他動〉To hug (one with affection)

content.content: ふるいつくよう可憐な少女だ
The girl is so lovely that you would like to hug her―She is a girl you would like to hug.

content:
ぶるいわけ〔部類分け〕
〈名〉Classification:(=する) to classify (things)

content.content: 物品を上中下と部類分けする
The goods, are classified as good, indifferent, and bad.
物品を三種に部類分けする
The goods are classified into three kinds.

content:
ふるいわける〔篩い分ける〕
〈他動〉To sift (truth from falsehood)

content.content: 善いのと悪いのをふるい分ける
to sift the good from the bad

content:
ふるう〔振るう、揮るう〕
〈他動〉
1. (=振って塵などを払う) to shake (a carpet)

content.content: 毛布を振るう
to shake a blanket
風上で着物を振るうのはまっぴらだ
Please don't shake your clothes to my windward.
鳥が羽根を振るう
A bird ruffles (itself).

content: 2. (=才能などを働かす) to exercise; exert (some sort of power); to show, display, exhibit (one's powers); to wield (a weapon); to put forth (one's energies); to resort to (force); to give scope to (one's genius); to give play to (one's talents); to use (policy or diplomacy)

content.content: 権力を揮るう
to exercise one's power―wield great power
下に対して権威を揮るう
to exercise one's authority over one's subordinates
才能を揮るう
to display one's powers―exhibit one's abilities
才を揮るう
to give play to one's talents―give scope to one's genius
技を揮るう
to display one's art―exhibit one's skill
筆を揮るう
to exert one's calligraphical powers―write with a flourish
健筆を揮るう
to wield a powerful pen
腕を揮るう
to exercise one's talent―show one's talent
弁を揮るう
to put forth one's eloquence―exert one's oratorical powers
弁舌を揮って人を説く
to exert one's powers of persuasion
熱弁を揮るう
to speak with fervour―harangue
手腕を揮う
to (use) finesse―use diplomacy―use policy―use tact
手腕を揮るってなしたことだ
It was done by a stroke of policy―by a stroke of diplomacy.
大いに手腕を揮るった
It was a great stroke of policy.
海外に国威を揮るうべし
Japan ought to make her power felt abroad―Japan's power ought to make itself felt abroad.
禍猛威を振るう
The evil makes its power felt―makes itself felt.
暴威を振るう
to tyrannize over―domineer over―lord it over―the people
暴力を振るう、腕力を振るう
to resort to force
畢生の力を振るう
to strive with all one's might
勇を振るう
to perform deeds of valour
勇気を振るう
to muster up one's courage―pluck up one's heart
蛮勇を振るう
to show one's naked valour
智慧を振るう
to set one's wits to work―fillip one's wits―cudgel one's brains
涙を揮るって馬稷を斬る
to sacrifice love to principle

content: 〈自動〉(=盛んなり) to flourish; to be successful; to be awake; to be active; to be spirited; to be vigorous; to be energetic; to be smart; to be bright

content.content: 日本の商工業は振るっている
Japan's commerce and industry are flourishing.
教会が振るう、振わぬ
The church is awake―asleep.
士気大いに振るう
The men are in high spirits―The martial spirit is excellent.
元気振るわず
They are in low spirits―depressed in spirits―dispirited.
商況振るう
Business ［Trade, The market］ is active―brisk.
商況振るわず
Business ［Trade, The market］ is inactive―dull―heavy―languid―slack―stagnant―at a low ebb―at a standstill.
彼のやり方は振るっている
His way of doing things is spirited―vigorous―energetic.
あの娘は振るっている
That girl is smart-looking―She cuts a smart figure.
妹の方は振るわぬ
Her sister cuts a poor figure―cuts a sorry figure.
日本の民間飛行家は振るわない
Our civilian aviators cut a poor figure.
この英文は振るっている
The English is smart―bright.
振るった趣向だ
It is a bright idea―a brilliant idea―a grand idea.
振るった思想だ
It is a pointed thought―an original thought.
あの先生の問題は振るっている
His questions are pointed.
彼の問いに対する君の答えもずいぶん振るっていた
Your answer to his question is quite original.
彼は晩年に至って大いに振るった
He was eminently successful late in life.
晩年振るわず
He outlived his fame.
末路振るわず
He closed his career in obscurity.
尾大振るわず
to be of unwieldy size
この書、結末大いに振るう
The book has a bright ending.
仙台は振るわないところだ
Sendai is a slow place.
万事振るわない
Things are no great shakes.
(屁と思うは)振るっている
That's a good one (=a good joke)―That's not bad.

At this rate, you will get very soon.

〈名〉
1. Discretion; judgment; wisdom; good sense

content.content: 男の四十は分別盛り
Forty is a man's years of discretion―years of mature judgment.
彼は分別盛りの男だ
He is a man of mature judgment.
分別がつく
to attain one's years of discretion―cut one's wisdom-teeth
君の分別にまかせる
I will leave the matter to your good sense.
醒めての上のご分別
“I appeal from Philip drunk to Philip sober.”

content: 2. ［古］(=工夫)a plan; an idea

content.content: 好い分別は無いか
Can't you think of some good plan?
どうも分別がつかぬ
I can't think of any plan.

ぶんべつ〔分別〕
〈名〉Discrimination; separation:(=する) to discriminate (between two things―one thing from another); to separate (one thing from another)

ふんべん〔糞便〕
〈名〉Excreta; dejecta; faeces; faecal matter

ぶんべん〔分娩〕
〈名〉Parturition; delivery; childbirth; child-bearing:(=する) to be delivered of a child; to be brought to bed of a child; to give birth to a child

content:
ふんぼ〔墳墓〕
〈名〉A grave; a tomb; a cemetery

content.content: 埋骨何期
What though I may not lay my bones
墳墓地
Wherein my fathers lie?
人間到処
Where'er I stray, I still may find
有青山
Some green spot where to die.

content:
ぶんぽう〔文法〕
〈名〉Grammar:(=の) grammatical

content.content: 文法を誤る
to make a grammatical mistake―use bad grammar―speak bad English―break grammatical rules―break Priscian's head
文法の誤り
a grammatical mistake―a grammatical error―a solecism―false syntax
文法上の誤りを正す
to correct grammatical mistakes
こう言うと文法にかなっていますか
Is it grammatical―good grammar―good English―to say so?
そう言うと文法にかなわない
It is ungrammatical―bad grammar―bad English―to say so.
文法上正しい、文法にかなっている
It is grammatical―grammatically correct.
文法上正しくない、文法にかなわぬ
It is ungrammatical―grammatically incorrect.
文法に拘泥する
to adhere too strictly to grammar
文法に拘泥していては英語が使えぬ
One can not speak or write English if one is over-anxious about grammar.
先生は文法に拘泥せぬ
He is careless about grammar―licentious about grammar.
先生は文法がやかましい
He is a stickler for grammar.
文法廃すべし
Away with grammar!
英文法
English grammar.
文法家
a grammarian
文法書
a grammar

a stationer

to harbour a vexed mood―be filled with indignation―be filled with resentment

ぶんみゃく〔文脈〕
〈名〉The context

content.content: 文脈に依て判断する
to judge the meaning by the context―infer the meaning from the context
言葉の意味は往々文脈によってわかることがある
The meaning of a word is often made clear by the context.

content:

〈形〉→『

content.content: ぶんめい〔分明〕

ふんむき〔噴霧器〕
〈名〉An atomizer; a sprayer

content:
ぶんめい〔分明〕
〈形〉
1. Clear; plain:(=する) to become clear; to become plain; to become known

content.content: その理由はたちまち分明した
The reason become clear.
この事実はどうして分明したか
How did the fact become known?

content: 2. (=何と分明する)to prove, turn out (to be true, false, etc.)

content.content: 問い合わせてみると評判は事実と分明した
On enquiry, the report proved (to be) true.
風説は事実無根と分明した
The rumour turned out (to be) false―proved to be unfounded.
その男は偽者と分明した
The man turned out to be a fraud―was found out to be an impostor.

content: 3. (=何者と身元分明する)to be identified (as such and such a person)

content.content: 一人の死体は某商人の娘と分明した
One body has been identified as the daughter of a certain merchant.
今一人の死体はまだ何者とも身元分明せず
The other body is not yet identified.

content:
ぶんめい〔文明〕
〈名〉Civilization; enlightenment:(=の) civilized; enlightened

content.content: 世は文明に進む
The world advances in civilization.
文明が進むに従って詩が衰える
As civilization advances, poetry declines.
文明の進歩
the advance of civilization―the progress of civilization
野蛮人を文明に導く
to civilize savages
この文明の世にそんなことを信ずる者は無い
Nobody will believe such things in this age of civilization―in this enlightened age.
これは文明の賜物だ
This is a gift of civilization.
文明の利器
the machinery of civilization―the appliances of civilization―the facilities of civilization―modern conveniences
泰西の文明
Western civilization―Occidental civilization.
物質的文明
material civilization
文明開化
civilization
文明国
a civilized country
文明諸国
the civilized nations―the civilized world
文明国民
a civilized people
文明の世
a civilized age―an enlightened age
文明史
the history of civilization

content:
ぶんめん〔文面〕
〈名〉The effect (of a letter, etc.)

content.content: その手紙は用があって来られないという文面であった
The letter was to the effect that business prevented his coming.
手紙の文面は左の如し
The letter ran as follows―read as follows:―

content:

〈名〉Separation; secession; disjunction; division; schism; split; segregation:(=する) to separate (from the mother country); to secede (from a state or a party); to disjoin (one body from another); to split; to be divided; to segregate

content.content: 米国が英国と分離した
America separated from England.
南方諸州が合衆国から分離した
The Southern States seceded from the Union.
キリスト教が分離して新旧教会に分かれた
Christianity split into the Roman and Protestant Churches.
内部が分離している
There is a schism in the body―a division in the camp.

content.content: 酒は分量を決めて飲むがよい

the classification of animals and plants

Words are classified into eight parts of speech.

content: 2. (=物品の分類)assortment:(=する) to assort (goods ―an article with a lot)

content.content: 奮励せよ

content:
ぶんれつ〔分裂〕
〈名〉Disunion; disruption; dissension; division; schism; split:(=する) to be disunited; to be disrupted; to be divided; to split; to break up

content.content: 国が分裂している
The country is disunited.
内部が分裂している
There is schism in the body―a division in the camp.
軍が分裂している
The army is divided against itself.
団結すれば立ち分裂すれば倒る
“United, we stand; divided, we fall.”

へ

to go to town
田舎へ行く
to go into the country
出口の方へ行こうとする
to make for the door

content:
へ〔屁〕
〈名〉
1. A fart(は尾籠); (a discharge of) wind:(屁の出ること)flatulence

content.content: 屁を放る
to break wind―fart
沈香も焚かず屁も放らず
He has few merits or faults―He is a man of negative virtues―“One who never made a mistake, never made anything.”
僕は屁が出て困る
I am troubled with wind―flatulent―troubled with flatulence.
芋を食うと屁が出る
Potatoes are flatulent.
屁の出る食物
flatulent food
屁の出る薬
a flatulent preparation
屁一つは薬千服に当たる
A single discharge of wind is equivalent to a thousand doses of medicine.
屁の出ぬ薬
a carminative
百日の説法屁一つ
All my talks has been in vain―“An hour may destroy what an age was building.”
彼は一日十時間の授業くらいは屁とも思わぬ
He makes nothing of teaching ten hours a day.
危険などは屁とも思わぬ
He cares nothing for dangers.
貴様は親父を屁とも思わぬ
You defy your father―set paternal authority at defiance.
屁の如きものだ
Nothing can be simpler.
そんなことは河童の屁だ
I make nothing of that.

content:
へい
〈応答詞〉Yes, sir

content.content: へいかしこまりました
Very well, sir.

content:
へい〔兵〕
〈名〉
1. (=兵士、兵卒)a soldier; a private; (an officer and his) men

content.content: 一隊の兵を率いて
at the head of a body of men
兵はバタバタ倒れた
The men were dropping on every side.
兵は国家の干城なり
The soldiers are the defenders of the State.
上等兵
a first-class private

content: 2. (=軍勢、軍隊)an army; troops

content.content: 兵を挙げる
to raise an army―raise a war
兵を募る
to levy an army―levy troops
兵を出す、兵を送る
to sent troops
兵を向ける
to send an army against the enemy
兵を率いる
to command an army―lead an army
兵を率いて
in command of an army―at the head of an army
兵を用いる
to handle troops―manipulate troops
兵を引上げる
to withdraw troops―draw off
兵を伏せる
to ambuscade troops―lay an ambuscade
兵を解く
to disband troops
敗残の兵を収める
to rally scattered troops
兵は国家の干城なり
The army is the bulwark of the State.

content: 3. (=戦争)war; warfare

content.content: 兵は凶争なり、兵は凶器なり
War is an evil―War is a curse.
兵は迅速を尚ぶ
“Celerity is the soul of warfare.”
兵は詐りをいとわず
“All is fair in love and war.”
敗軍の将は兵を談ぜず
A defeated general should not talk of war.

content.content: Macaulay の文章は平易でわかりやすい
Macaulay is easy to understand.
この本は文章が平易で初学者にも読める
The book is written in such easy English that beginners can read it.
誰にでもわかるように平易に書け
Write it in such easy language as anybody can understand.
むつかしいことを平易に説明する
to explain a difficult matter in easy language

content:
へいえき〔兵役〕
〈名〉Military service; conscription

content.content: 兵役に就く
to enter military service
兵役に服す
to serve in the army
兵役をすます
to serve one's time
兵役を免除される
to be exempted from military service
兵役免除
exemption from military service
身体が不合格で兵役を免れた
He was exempted from military service owing to physical disqualification―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Physical disqualification exempted him from military service.
兵役を猶予される
to be temporarily exempted from military service
兵役猶予
temporary exemption from military service
あの学校へ入ると兵役猶予になる
The school will temporarily exempt you from military service.
本校は兵役猶予の特典あり
The school enjoys conscription privileges.
男子は皆兵役の義務がある
Every male subject is liable for military service.
(挙国)兵役義務
(universal) liability for military service
兵役は国民の義務
Military service is one of the duties of citizenship.
義務兵役
compulsory military service
二年兵役
two years' service system
二年兵役は実施になっている
The two-years' system is in operation.
兵役年間

兵役満期
the completion of military service
君はいつ兵役が満期になるか
When do you complete your term of service?―serve out your time?
もう兵役満期になった
I have served out my time―served my full time.

〈名〉Peace; quiet; calm; tranquility:(=な) peaceful (times); peaceable (behaviour); pacific (disposition); quiet (life); calm (sea or weather); tranquil (repose, etc.)

content.content: ほど無く平穏に復した
It was not long before peace was restored.
平穏無事に暮らす
to live in peace and quiet
平穏無事な生活
a quiet life―a tranquil existence
平穏無事な生涯
an uneventful career
農家の厄日も平穏無事に過ぎた
The critical day for farmers has passed quietly.

A million men of all arms were sent to Manchuria.

His Imperial Majesty (H. I. M.) the Emperor.
皇后陛下

content:
べいか〔米価〕
〈名〉The price of rice; the rice quotation

content.content: 米価騰貴
the rise in the price of rice―the appreciation of rice
米価が騰貴した
The price of rice has risen―Rice has risen (in price)―Rice has appreciated.
米価は三十円台に騰貴した
The rice quotation has risen to the thirty yen level.
米価下落
the fall in the price of rice―the depreciation of rice
米価が下落した
The price of rice has fallen―Rice has fallen (in price)―Rice has depreciated.

The rice quotation has fallen to fifteen and odd yen.
米価を調節する
to regulate the price of rice
米価調節
the regulation of the price of rice

content.content: 今日はこれで閉会致します
The meeting is closed―The sitting is at an end.
会長が閉会を宣告した
The chairman declared the meeting closed―declared the sitting at an end.
議会は今日閉会になる
The Diet is prorogued―The Diet rises―today.
議会は閉会中だ
The Diet is out of session.

content:

content.content: 共和政治にも弊害がある
A republic has its evils―A republic is subject to abuses.
こんな本は風教に弊害を及ぼすおそれあり
Such books are apt to have evil influence on the public morals.
弊害を矯正する
to remedy abuses―suppress abuses―put down evils

へいがくしゃ〔兵学者〕

content.content: 海軍兵学校
the Naval Academy

content.content: 兵器製造
manufacture of arms
兵器工
an armourer
兵器部
the Ordnance Department

content:
へいき〔平気〕
〈名〉
1. Unconcern; calmness; serenity; composure; coolness; indifference; carelessness; nonchalance; sang-froid:(=な) unconcerned; calm; serene; composed; cool; indifferent; careless; nonchalant; unmoved; imperturbable:(=で) calmly; coolly; serenely; caressly; unconcernedly; with unconcern; with indifference; with nonchalance; with sang-froid

content.content: 彼は平気な顔をしている
He looks quite unconcerned.
暑い寒いは平気だ
I don't care about heat or cold―I am careless about heat or cold―I am indifferent about heat or cold.
彼は賞められようと笑われようと平気なものだ
He is indifferent to praise or censure.
彼はどんな危険に逢っても平気の平左衛門だ
He is as cool as a cucumber―perfectly calm and serene―in presence of any danger―He shows the utmost sang-froid―He will not turn a hair―in presence of any danger.
彼らは人の溺死するのも平気で見ている
They look on,quite unmoved,―with perfect unconcern,―at a drowning man.
彼は息子の訃音に接しても平気でおった
He received the news of his son's death with perfect composure―with perfect nonchalance―with perfect indifference.
平気な顔をして眺めている
He looks on with an unconcerned air―with a nonchalant air―with an unmoved countenance―without moving a muscle of his face.
彼はいくら借金があっても平気の平左衛門だ
With all his debts, he is perfectly calm and serene.
老人でも平気で見ていられぬほどの美人だ
Age can not look at her with indifference.
平気を装う
to assume an indifferent air―put on an unconcerned air―put a good face on the matter―carry it off well
平気を装っているけれども内心は心配なんだ
He is internally anxious, although he puts a good face on the matter―carries it off so well.

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 張子でないから雨が降っても平気だ、濡れても平気だ
I don't mind the rain―I don't mind getting wet―I am not made of sugar―I am not made of salt.
彼は一日十時間の授業くらいは平気だ(何とも思わぬ)
He makes nothing of teaching ten hours a day.
あの男はどんな悪いことでも平気でする
He will do any evil without compunction―without remorse―without scruple―He will scruple at nothing―stick at nothing.
嘘を吐くくらいは平気だ
He will make no scruple of lying―make no bones of lying―make nothing of lying.
人殺しくらいは平気だ
He makes nothing of murder―He is hardened to crime.
人に舌を巻かしておいて何事も無きように平気で座に復した
After astonishing everybody, he resumed his seat as if nothing had happened―as if nothing were the matter.
彼は失敗しても平気なもんだ(呑気なもんだ)
He takes his failure quite easy.
僕は一度の失敗くらいは平気だ(少しも困らぬ)
I am none the worse for a single failure.
彼は幾日徹夜しても平気な様子している
He can sit up nights on end, and look none the worse for it.
いくら酒を飲んでも平気だ
He is none the worse for drinking any quantity of wine―Wine has no effect on him.
若い者はいくら暴飲暴食をしても平気だ(崇りが無い)
Young men commit all sorts of excesses with impunity.
僕は新聞の攻撃くらいは(慣れているから)いっこう平気だ
I am quite used to newspaper attacks.
彼はどんな恥をかいても平気だ
Noting can abash him.
哲学上の問題を考える時は心を虚心平気にして
Philosophical questions should be considered without prejudice―free from all bias―with entire submission of self.

content:
へいきん〔平均〕
〈名〉
1. (=ならし)the average; the par (of many numbers); the mean (between two numbers):(副詞に用いれば)on the average; on an average, on a par:(=の) average; mean:(=する) to average

content.content: 彼の収入は(月によって違うが)平均千円くらいのものだ
He makes, on an average, about 1,000 yen a month―His income averages about 1,000 yen a month.
