〈名〉Engagement:(=する) to engage (a foreign teacher, etc.); to secure one's services

content.content: 支那へ聘用されて行った
He has obtained an engagement in China.
外国人聘用の交渉中だ
We are negotiating with a foreigner for his services.

へいらん〔兵乱〕
〈名〉War; troubles; disturbances

content:
へいり〔弊履〕
〈名〉Old sandals

content.content: 職をなげうつこと弊履を捨つるが如し
He threw up his office just as he would threw away an old hat.

content:
へいりつ〔並立〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: りょうりつ〔両立〕

content:
へいりゃく〔兵略〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ぐんりゃく〔軍略〕

content:
へいりょく〔兵力〕
〈名〉
1. (=武力)military power; force of arms; the sword; the sabre

content.content: 兵力を以て(国を)治める
to rule by the sword―by the sabre
兵力を養う
to prepare oneself for war
兵力に訴える
to appeal to arms―go to war
よくよくのことでなければ兵力に訴えるものでない
All peaceable means must be exhausted before appealing to arms.
兵力を以て問題を解決する
to settle a question by force of arms―submit a dispute to the arbitrament of war
兵力を用いずに問題を解決する
to settle a dispute without an appeal to arms

content: 2. (=兵数)the numerical strength of an army

content.content: 敵は兵力優勢
The enemy were superior to us in numbers.

content:
へいわ〔平和〕
〈名〉
1. Peace:(=の) peaceful; pacific:(=に) peacefully

content.content: 日本は隣国と平和なり
Japan is at peace with her neighbours.
日本は東洋の平和のために二度義軍を起こした
Japan has twice waged righteous war for the peace of the East―in the cause of peace.
平和を維持する
to maintain peace
平和を破る
to break the peace
平和を害す
to be prejudicial to peace
平和を攪乱する
to disturb the peace
東洋の平和を危うする
to menace ［be a menace to］ the peace of the East
平和を確保する
to ensure peace
平和を提議する
to make overtures of peace―hold out the olive branch
平和を締結する
to make peace―conclude peace―with the enemy
平和を回復する
to restore peace―restore the country to peace
平和克復す
Peace is restored―The country is restored to peace.
平和克復
the restoration of peace
事件は平和に局を結んだ
The affair has come to a peaceful termination―been brought to an amicable settlement.
軍備は平和なり
Armament is peace―Arms carry peace.
武装的平和
armed peace
商業は平和の戦争なり
Commerce is war in peace.
名誉の平和
honourable peace―peace with honour
不名誉の平和
dishonourable peace
絶対平和(国を裂いても平和)
peace at any price―peace on any terms
自由を犠牲にしても平和を求めるは奴隷国民
A nation of slaves will purchase peace at the price of liberty.
平和会議
peace conference―peace congress
万国平和会議
the international peace conference
平和会議の場所はパリに決まった
Paris was fixed upon as the seat of peace conference.
平和条約
a treaty of peace
平和主義
pacifism
平和主義者
a pacifist
平和運動
a pacifist movement
一家の平和
domestic concord―domestic harmony
一家の平和を保つ
to maintain domestic harmony
一家の平和を乱す
to disturb domestic harmony

へがす〔剥がす〕
〈他動〉To tear off (a label); to rip off (wall-paper); to strip off (the bark of a tree); to flake off (the crust of cake, etc.)

content:
べからず〔可からず〕
〈助動詞相当〉Must not

content.content: 授業中談話すべからず
You must not talk in class―No talking in class.
校内にて喫煙すべからず
No smoking within school-bounds.
楽書すべからず
No scribbling on the walls.
無用の者入るべからず
No admittance except on business.
かくあるべからず
It must not be so.
かくあらざるべからず
It can not but be so.

content:
へき〔癖〕
〈名〉A habit (of doing something); a propensity (to some vice); a weakness (for some luxury); a mania (for something particular)

content.content: 彼は読書癖がある
He has a mania for reading.

content:
べき〔冪〕
〈名〉Power

content.content: 冪数
an exponent

へぎいた〔片木板〕
〈名〉Shingles (for roofing); splints (used in bone-setting)

content:
へきえきする〔辟易する〕
〈自動〉
1. (=恐れ避ける)to flinch (from a difficulty); to shrink (from a difficult task); to wince (under pain); to succumb (to calamities); to be daunted (by failure); to give way (to or before superior numbers); to cave in

content.content: この困難を見ては辟易せぬ者は無い
Everybody shrinks from the difficulties―flinches from the difficulties.
さすがの星もこの悪口には辟易した
Even Hoshi winced under this calumny.
さすがのドイツも世界を敵にしては辟易せざるを得なかった
Even Germany could not but succumb to a combination of the world against her.
彼は失敗如きに容易に辟易する男でない
He is not to be daunted by failure.
敵は日本軍の勇猛に辟易して退いた
The enemy gave way before Japanese valour.
内閣は議会の態度に辟易した
The attitude of the Diet made the Cabinet cave in.
へいこうする〔閉口する〕
この問題には辟易した
The problem beats me.
品は良いとしても価には辟易する
The quality may be good, but the price beats me.
寒いのはかまわないが暑いのには避易する
I do not mind the cold, but I can't stand the heat.

へきえんのち〔僻遠の地〕
〈名〉A remote place; an out-of-way corner

へきかい〔劈開〕
〈名〉Cleavage:(=する) to cleave

content:
へきがん〔碧眼〕
〈名〉Blue eyes

content.content: 碧眼児、碧眼奴
a foreigner

content:
へきくう〔碧空〕
〈名〉The blue sky; the azure

content.content: 碧空一点の雲無し
There is not a cloud in the sky―The sky is cloudless.

content:
へきけん〔僻見〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: へんけん〔偏見〕

content:
へきする〔僻する〕
〈自動〉To be biassed; to be prejudiced

content.content: それは僻した考えだ
That is a biassed view of the matter.

へきそん〔僻村〕
〈名〉A remote village

content:
へきち〔僻地〕
〈名〉A remote place; an out-of-the-way corner

content.content: 山間の僻地
mountain solitudes

content:
へきとうだいいちに〔劈頭第一に〕
〈副〉In the first place; at the very beginning; at the outset; to begin with

content.content: 劈頭第一に述べておかねばならないことは
I must observe in the first place that...
劈頭第一に言わねばならぬことはこの人は信者である
He is a Christian, to begin with.
劈頭第一に彼の名が出ている
His name heads the list―leads the rest.

content:
べきものである
〈助動詞相当〉Should

content.content: 借りたものは返すべきものである
One should pay what one owes.

content:
べきものでない
〈助動詞相当〉Should not

content.content: 弱い者いじめはすべきものでない
One should not bully the weak.

へきゆう〔僻邑〕
〈名〉An obscure locality:(より)our place

content:
へきれき〔霹靂〕
〈名〉A peal of thunder; a thunderclap

content.content: 霹靂一声
There is a clap of thunder―a peal of thunder.
晴天の霹靂だ
It is a bolt from the blue.
この報は商業界には晴天の霹靂であった
The commercial world was thunderstruck at the news.

へきろん〔僻論〕
〈名〉A biassed view; a prejudiced opinion

へげ〔片げ〕
〈名〉A flake (of crust); a chip (of stone, etc.)

content:
ペケ
〈名〉No go

content.content: ペケになる
to come to naught―be rejected
計画がペケになった
The scheme has come to naught.
出品がペケになった
The exhibits have been rejected.

へげる〔片げる〕
〈自動〉To flake off; to come off in flakes

へこおび〔兵児帯〕
〈名〉An undress belt

へこたれ
〈名〉(=へこたれ虫)A weakling; a coward; a poltroon

content:
へこたれる
〈自動〉
1. (=落胆する、挫折する)to lose heart; to falter

content.content: 相変らず威張ったことを言っていたが、いよいよという時へこたれてしまった
He had been talking bit as usual, but he faltered at the last moment.
いよいよという時にへこたれないように常に腕を鍛えておくのだ
We must keep our hands in, lest we should lose heart at the supreme moment―lest our heart should fail us at the supreme moment.

content: 2. (=屈する、弱る)to be daunted; to be dejected; to be cast down

content.content: 彼は失敗してへこたれている
He is dejected―cast down―by his failure.
いやいや彼は失敗くらいに容易にへこたれる人間じゃない
He is not easily to be daunted by failure.

content: 3. (=倒れる)to give out

content.content: 途中でへこたれる者が多い
Many give out on the way.

content:
ペコペコ
〈副〉
1. Bobbingly

content.content: 頭をペコペコ下げる
to bob one's head―cringe
日本の商人は客の前で頭をペコペコ下げる
A Japanese tradesman bobs his head before his customer.
彼は目上の人にペコペコする
He cringes to his superiors.
腹がペコペコになった
I am famishing―famished.

content:
へこます〔凹ます〕
〈他動〉
1. (叩いてへこます)to dent (a surface):(押してへこます)to make (anything) yield (under pressure)
2. (=辱める)to humiliate (a proud man); to humble (one's pride); to snub, sit upon (a man); to put (one) down; to take (one) down a peg or two

content.content: 生意気な奴はへこましておくに限る
There is nothing like snubbing a conceited fellow.
へこましておくと本人のためにも好い
A wholesome snubbing will do him good.
あんな者にへこまされていてはいかん
You must not suffer yourself to be sat upon by such fellows.
あまり威張っているからへこましてやって愉快だ
I am glad to have humbled his pride―cut his comb.

content:
へこむ〔凹む〕
〈自動〉
1. (叩くとへこむ)to be dented:(押すとへこむ)to yield (to pressure); to give (under pressure):(踏むとへこむ)to give (beneath the feet)

content.content: 表面が所々へこんでいる
The surface is dented in places.
帽子がデコボコへこんでいる
It is a battered hat.
脚気で足がふくれているから押すとへこむ
My legs are swollen with beriberi, and yield to pressure―give under pressure.

content: 2. (=恥じて引込む)to be humbled; to lower one's note; to lower one's tone; to sing small

content.content: あの男はこちらが強くでるとたちまちへこんでしまう
If you take the high hand with him, he will lower his note at once.
彼は長者の前へ出るとへこんでいる
He is humble in the presence of his superiors.
彼は隅っこにへこんでいた
He was crouched in a corner―crouching in a corner.
失敗したもんだからへこんでいた
He was abashed―chap-fllen―crest-fallen―after his failure.

へさき〔舳先〕
〈名〉The bow (of a ship); the prow (of a junk)

content:
べし〔可し〕
〈助動詞相当〉
1. (=何々すべし)let, should, ought, must (または命令法、不定法)

content.content: 各員努力すべし
Let each man do his best.
長者の言には従うべしだ
You should obey your superiors.
借りたものは返すべしだ
One ought to pay what one owes.
もっと勉強すべしだ
You must work harder.
学生はこの入口より入るべし
The students to enter at this door.

content: 2. (=何々なるべし)may; must; ought; shall; will

content.content: 誤りなるべし
It may be a mistake―It must be a mistake.
さもあるべし
It ought to be so.
求めよさらばこれを得べし
Look, and you shall find.
おそらく明日は雨なるべし
Perhaps it will rain tomorrow.

content:
ぺーじ〔頁<ページ>〕
〈名〉A page

content.content: 本にページを付ける
to page a book―paginate a book
十ページ書いた
I have covered ten pages.
百二十五ページを明ける
Open the book at page 125.
その絵は十二ページにある
You will find the picture on page 12.

content:
ぺーじ〔頁<ページ>〕
〈名〉A page

content.content: 本にページを付ける
to page a book―paginate a book
十ページ書いた
I have covered ten pages.
百二十五ページを明ける
Open the book at page 125.
その絵は十二ページにある
You will find the picture on page 12.

content:
へしあう〔圧し合う〕
〈自動〉To jostle each other

content.content: 押し合いへし合う
to jostle one another

content:
へす〔減す〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: へらす〔減らす〕

content:
ペスト
〈名〉Pest; the (bubonic) plague

content.content: ペストにかかる
to be attacked with pest
ペストで死ぬ
to die of pest
ペスト流行す
Pest prevails.
ペスト流行地
a pest-stricken district
ペス菌
a pest-bacillus

content:
へそ〔臍〕
〈名〉The navel; the umbilicus

content.content: おヘソが茶を沸かす
to be tickled

content:
べそ
〈名〉A sob; a snivel; a snuffle

content.content: べそかく
to sob―snivel―snuffle
べそかいて泣く
to blubber
べそかきながら言う
to blubber out something

へそくりがね〔臍繰金〕
〈名〉(A wife's) secret hoard

へそくる〔臍繰る〕
〈自動〉(A wife) secretly hoards money (out of the family expenses)

content:
へそちゃしごく〔臍茶至極〕
〈熟語〉Just think of that!; The idea!

content.content: 彼が総理大臣とはへそ茶至極である
Just thing of his being Prime Minister!
あの男がそんな高言を吐くとはへそ茶の至りだ
The idea of his talking in such a lofty strain!

content:
へそのお〔臍の緒〕
〈名〉The navel-string; the umbilical cord

content.content: こんな目に逢うのはヘソの緒切って初めてだ
I never had such an experience in my life.
これを見るのはヘソの緒切って初めてだ
I never saw it in all my born days.

content:
へた〔下手〕
〈名、形〉
1. A bad hand, a poor hand (at anything); ill (at doing anything); awkward (management); clumsy (handiwork); bungling (workman); indifferent (poems, etc.)

content.content: あの人の英語が下手だ
He speaks English poorly―He is a poor English speaker.
彼は会話は下手だが訳は上手だ
He speaks poorly, but translates well―He is a poor speaker, but a good translator.
僕は話が下手だ
I am a poor hand at telling stories―not much of a hand at telling stories―a poor story-teller.
僕は言い訳が下手だ
I am ill at making excuses.
西洋人は箸を持つことが下手だ
Foreigners are awkward with chopsticks.
彼は下手な詩を作る
He writes indifferent poems.
彼が本当にそう言ったなら嘘を吐くことが下手だ
If he really said so, he has a poor imagination.
君はあんな物を選ぶようでは見立てが下手だ
Your choice shows the you have bad taste.
下手な鍛冶屋も一度は名剣
A poor blacksmith will make a good sword once in his life.
下手の道具立て
A bad workman quarrels with his tools.
下手な料理には閉口だ
The bad cooking beats me.
香々の方が下手な料理に勝しだ
Pickles are better than poor dishes.
下手の横好き
He is always at it, and always bad at it.
下手な節倹かえって家を亡ぼす
Bad economy is ruinous.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 下手の長談義
“Brevity is the soul of wit.”
下手な細工だ
It is botched work―a botch.
下手な絵だ
It is a daub.
彼は下手な英語を使う
He speaks broken English―murders the King's English.
(玉突きは)近頃やらないから下手になっている
I am rather out of practice―My hand is out.
英語は始終やらないとじきに下手になる
You must practise English constantly, or you soon get out of practice.
これは下手に口も出せない
It is a delicate matter.
こりゃ下手に手出しもできぬわい
It is delicate business, I declare.
下手をやる
to blunder―bungle―make a mess of it―have a tinker at it
下手をやって縁談をぶちこわした
The match was broken off through want of tact.
下手するとやりそこなうぞ
Take care, or you will spoil the game.
下手まごつくと取り返しのつかないことになるぞ
If you don't take care, you will commit a fatal blunder.

content:
べたいちめんに〔べた一面に〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: べたに

content:
へだたり〔隔り〕
〈名〉
1. (=距離)distance (from one place to another)
2. (=差、懸隔)difference; disparity

content.content: 二人の年に隔りがある
There is a disparity of age between the two―Their ages differ too much.

content:
へだたる〔隔たる〕
〈自動〉To be distant (from a place); to be apart (from each other)

content.content: 都は海岸から五十マイル隔たっている
The capital is forty miles (distant) from the coast.
その爆発は十里隔たったここまで響いた
The shock caused by the explosion was felt here at a distance of 10 leagues.
日本では親子の間が隔たっているように見える
In Japan, the relation between parent and child seems to be distant.
村と村とが五マイル隔たっている
The villages are five miles apart.

content:
へだつ〔隔つ〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: へだたる〔隔たる〕
今を隔つる五十年前
fifty years ago

content:
べたつく
〈自動〉→『

content.content: べたべたする〔ベタベタする〕

content:
へだて〔隔て〕
〈名〉
1. (=隔意)reserve; coldness

content.content: 隔て無く話す
to speak without reserve
友人間に隔てができた
A coldness came between the two friends―They became estranged.

content: 2. (=差)difference

content.content: 恋に上下の隔て無し
There is no difference of rank in love―Love puts all on a level―Love is a leveller.

content: 3. (=差別)distinction; discrimination

content.content: 僕は人によって隔てをつけるようなことはせぬ
I make no distinction between one man and another―I do not discriminate between one man and another―I do not make flesh of one and fish of another.
日本人と西洋人を隔て無く扱う
I do not discriminate between Japanese and foreigners.
貴賤上下の隔て無くこの日を祝う
High and low celebrate the day.

content:
へだてる〔隔てる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=離す)to separate (one thing from another)

content.content: 障子を隔てて姿が見えぬ
I can not see her, for I am separated from her by the paper-screen―The paper-screen stands between her and me―The paper-screen hides her from view.
障子を隔てて声が聞こえる
I hear her voice on the other side of the paper-screen―through the paper-screen.

content: 2. (=挟む)to place (something) between (two objects)

content.content: 馬関と門司は海峡を隔てている
Bakan and Moji have the straits between them.
馬関と門司は海峡を隔てて相対す
Bakan and Moji face each other with the straits between them―across the straits.
海峡を隔てて門司あり
Moji stands across the straits.
両軍は河を隔てて対陣した
The two armies faced each other with the river between them―across the river.
電柱は三十間ずつ隔てて立つ
The poles stand at intervals of sixty yards.

content: 3. (=離間する)to come between (two persons); to alienate (parent and child―parent from child); to estrange (friends―friend from friend)

content.content: 友人の間を隔てる
(離間策を施すの意味なら)to estrange friends―make mischief―(無意味なら)―Something comes between two friends

content:
べたなぎ〔べた凪ぎ〕
〈名〉A dead calm

content.content: べた凪ぎに凪いだ
It fell a dead calm.

content:
べたに
〈副〉All over

content.content: べた(一面)にある
They are found all over the place.
壁にはべた(一面)に書き散らしてある
The walls are scrawled all over.

へたばる
〈自動〉
1. (=ひれふす)to fall prostrate
2. (=倒れる)to be laid low; to drop will fatigue
3. (=へこむ)to lower one's note; to sing small

content:
ベタベタ
〈副〉

content.content: 顔にベタベタ白粉を塗る
to paint one's thick with powder
壁に広告をベタベタ貼る
to stick bills and posters all over the walls―cover the walls all over with bills and posters

べたべたする〔ベタベタする〕
〈自動〉
1. To be soft and sticky; to be soft as butter; to be buttery; to be curdy; to be doughy; to be pasty; to be pulpy; to be of a pulpy consistency
2. (=男女がベタベタする)to dally, flirt, fondle, bill and coo (with a man or woman)

べたべたする〔ベタベタする〕
〈自動〉
1. To be soft and sticky; to be soft as butter; to be buttery; to be curdy; to be doughy; to be pasty; to be pulpy; to be of a pulpy consistency
2. (=男女がベタベタする)to dally, flirt, fondle, bill and coo (with a man or woman)

content:
へちま〔糸瓜〕
〈名〉The sponge-cucumber; the sponge-gourd; the snake-gourd; the towel-gourd; the loofah

content.content: 俺に謝罪しろって、謝罪もヘチマもあるものか
I apologize? Apologize your grandmother!―Apology me no apology!

content:
ベチャクチャ
〈擬音詞〉→『

content.content: ペチャクチャ

content:
ペチャクチャ
〈擬音詞〉(The sound of) chattering

content.content: ペチャクチャ喋る
to chatter―jabber―babble―gabble

content:

content:
べつ〔別〕
〈名〉
1. (=区別)distinction

content.content: 黒白の別
distinction between right and wrong
教育に男女の別がある
There is a sexual distinction in education.
法律には貴賤の別無し

The law makes no distinction of rank―The law has no respect of persons―The law is no respecter of persons―There is no distinction of rank in the eyes of the law―All men are equal in the eyes of the law.
夫婦別あり
Husband and wife have distinct duties.
(何々の)別無く
without distinction―alike
貴賤上下の別無く皆この道に迷う
All get lost in this maze without distinction of rank or standing―irrespective of rank or standing―High and low (alike)―Great and small (alike)―Gentle and simple (alike)―lose themselves in this maze.
老若男女の別無く皆花を愛す
Old and young men and women (alike) love the flowers―The flowers are loved by all without distinction of age or sex―irrespective of age or sex.
貧富の別無く皆この日を祝う
Rich and poor (alike) celebrate this day.
昼夜の別無く働く
They work night and day.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 僕は内外人の別無く取扱う
I do not discriminate between Japanese and foreigners.
君臣の別をわきまえている
I know my place as subject.

content: 2. (=別物)a distinct thing; a different thing; another thing; a special case; an exception

content.content: 言うと行なうとは別
To say is one thing, to do is another thing.
英語を使うと教えるとは別
To speak English is one thing, to teach it is quite another thing―(洒落て言うと)―another pair of shoes.
(いつも机を離れたことは無いが)今日は別だ
But today is an exception.
(僕は子どもは好きでないが)この子だけは別だ
But this is an exception.
君は別だ
You are an exception―Yours is a special case.
経費問題は別として(さておいて)まだ一つの問題がある
Apart from―Setting apart―Setting aside―the question of expense, there is still another consideration.
俸給は別にして(さておいて)著述の方からもだいぶ収入がある
He has a large income from his books, besides his salary―to say nothing of his salary―not to speak of his salary―not to mention his salary―let alone his salary.

いくらひいき目で見ても別に取柄が無い

彼は別にこれという道楽も無い
He has no particular hobby.

I will get another book.
弟は別に家を建てた

rouge, powder, and what not
顔に紅や白粉をつける
to paint one's face

べにくりげ〔紅栗毛〕

〈名〉A bay (horse)

べにさしゆび〔紅差指〕

べにすずめ〔紅雀〕

へばりつく

content:
へび〔蛇〕
〈名〉A snake:(大きいのは)a serpent

content.content: 蛇がニョロニョロ匍う
A snake crawls (on its belly).
蛇が脱け変る
A snake casts its skin―A snake sheds its skin.
蛇の脱け殻
a snake's skin
蛇が蛙を呑む
A snake swallows frogs.
蛇に噛まれる
to be bitten by a snake
蛇を馴らす
to charm a snake
毒のある蛇
a venomous snake
毒の無い蛇
an innocuous snake
悪魔が蛇に化けて Eve を欺いた(というのは聖書にあらずして Milton の神話)
Satan turned himself into a serpent, and deceived Eve.
蛇の如く賢く鳩の如く温和なれ
“Be ye wise as serpents and gentle as doves.”
君は藪を突ついて蛇を出すのだ
You can not let well alone.
藪蛇(を出すな)
“Let well alone!”―“Let sleeping dogs lie!”
盲人蛇に怖じず
Ignorance is bold―“Foods rush in where angels fear to tread.”
蛇の道は蛇
“Like knows like”―“Set a thief to catch a thief.”

へびいちご〔蛇苺〕
〈名〉A kind of wild strawberry

へびつかい〔蛇使い〕
〈名〉A snake-charmer

ヘベレケ

content.content: ヘベレケに酔っている
He is dead drunk―beastly drunk.

content.content: ヘボ学者
a poor scholar
ヘボ先生
a poor teacher

へぼきゅうり〔ヘボ胡瓜〕
〈名〉A stunted cucumber; a gherkin

content:
ヘマ
〈名〉
1. A blunder

content.content: ヘマをやる
to commit a blunder―make a mess of it―bungle
ヘマな奴だ
You are a bungler.
あの男は口を利くときっとヘマなことを言う
He can not open his mouth without putting his foot in it.
ヘマに行く
to go wrong―go amiss―go away
今日は何事もヘマに行く日だ
Everything goes wrong with me today.
いくらヘマに行っても資本を棒に振るだけのことだ
I can but lose my capital at the worst.

へめぐる〔歴廻る〕
〈自他動〉To wander about (the world); to travel about (the country, etc.)

content:
へや〔部屋〕
〈名〉A room; an apartment

content.content: 君の部屋は何番か
What is the number of your room?
君は自分の部屋があるのか
Have you a room of your own?
めいめいに部屋がある
Each has his own room.
僕は八畳の部屋に一人だ
I have an eight-mat room to myself.
この部屋はあいているか
Is this room unoccupied?
この部屋はふさがっている
This room is occupied.
この部屋もじきにふさがる
This room will soon be taken, too.
この部屋にいるのは誰か
Who is the occupant of this room?―Who occupies this room?

content:
へやずみ〔部屋住み〕
〈名〉One who is dependent on one's father

content.content: 彼はまだ部屋住みの身だ
He is still dependent on his father.

content:
へらす〔減らす〕
〈他動〉To decrease (the number); to diminish (the value); to lessen (the hours); to reduce (the expenses); to abate (one's ardour); to bate (one's demands); to take from (the value, etc.)

content.content: 数を三十に減らした
The number has been decreased to thirty.
数を三十(だけ)減らした
The number has been decreased by thirty.
時間を減らしてもらいたい
I wish to have my hours lessened―I wish to be eased of some hours.
一週十二時間に減らして下さい
I wish to have my hours lessened to 12 hours a week.
六時間だけ減らして下さい
I wish to have my hours lessened by six hours.
月給を七十円に減らされた
My salary has been reduced to 70 yen.
三十円だけ減らされた
My salary has been reduced by 30 yen.
口を減らすために子どもを奉公に出した
They put out their children to service in order to lessen the number of mouths to feed.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 読み方を減らして文法を増やして下さい
We want less reading and more grammar.
三杯の飯を二杯に減らす
to put oneself on short commons
親は三杯の飯を二杯に減らして子どもに修業をさせる
The parents would make any sacrifices in order to give their children an education.
腹をへらす
to be hungry
この子はよく腹をへらす子だ
The child is always hungry.
働いて腹をへらす、散歩して腹をへらす
to work oneself hungry―walk oneself hungry
時間が多過ぎるから少し減らしていただきたい
I wish to be eased of some hours.

content:
へらずぐち〔減らず口〕
〈名〉(A woman's) last word

content.content: 女はへらず口をたたきたがる
A woman will have the last word.
へらず口をたたくな
Shut up!―Hold your tongue!

content:
ベラベラ
〈副〉Glibly; volubly

content.content: ベラベラしゃべる
to talk glibly―talk volubly―babble―gabble
よくベラベラしゃべる男だ
He is talkative―loquacious―garrulous.

content:
ペラペラ
〈副〉Glibly; volubly

content.content: ペラペラしゃべる
to talk glibly
よくペラペラしゃべること
How he runs on!

べらぼうに〔箆棒に〕
〈副〉Awfully (hot); confoundedly (cold); devilishly (dear, etc.)

べらぼうめ〔箆棒め〕
〈間投詞〉By Jingo!; By the living Jingo!

content:
へり〔縁〕
〈名〉The hem (of a handkerchief); the fringe (of a curtain); the border (of a mat); the edge (of a desert); the brim (of a hat); the margin (of a page); the bank (of a stream); the trimmings (of a coat)

content.content: へりを取る
to hem a handkerchief―fringe a curtain―border a mat―trim a coat (with lace)

content:
へり〔減り〕
〈名〉Decrease; loss:(摩り減りなら)wear

content.content: 米を搗くと一俵につき約五升減りが立つ
In cleaning rice, there is a loss of 5 sho per bag.

へりかざり〔縁飾り〕
〈名〉The fringe (of a curtain); the trimmings (of a coat)

へりくだる〔へり下る〕
〈自動〉To condescend; to humble oneself; to take a back seat

content:
へりくつ〔屁理屈〕
〈名〉Quibbles; quips; quirks; quiddities; quillets; cavil; sophism; sophistry

content.content: 屁理屈を言う、屁理屈を並べる
to quibble―cavil

へりくつや〔屁理屈屋〕
〈名〉A quibbler; a caviller; a sophist

content:
へる〔経る〕
〈他動〉
1. To go through (some experience); to pass through (one's hands); to undergo (hardships)

content.content: 彼は艱難辛苦を経ている
He has gone through hardships―undergone hardships.
だいぶ艱難辛苦を経て来ている
He has gone through much.
危険も経ている
He has gone through dangers even.
この職業に就く者は試験を経なければならぬ
In order to enter this profession, you must go through an examination.
彼の手を経る金は少々の金ではない
Large sums of money pass through his hands.
銀行の手を経て金を送る
to remit money through a bank
金は友人の手を経て送った
I sent money by the hand of a friend.
校正は必ず僕の目を経ることになっている
The proofs must pass may eye.
手続きを経る
to go through a process―go through formalities
請願書は順序を経て差出すべし
Petitions must be presented through the proper authorities.
入学願書は地方庁を経て差出すべし
The application shall be made through the local authorities.
悪疫流行地を経て来た貨物は消毒を要す
Goods coming through the infected districts must be disinfected.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 条約は批准を経たか
Has the treaty received Imperial Sanction?
米国を経てヨーロッパへ行く
to go to Europe by way of America―via America
功労を経る
to have experience―be experienced
功労を経た人
an experienced man―an old stager
彼は年は若いが功労を経ている
He is young in years, but old in experience―old in crime―old in cunning.
時を経る
Time passes―Time elapses―Time goes on―Time goes by.［注意］日英語位転倒。
そのことがあってから多くの年月を経ている
Years have elapsed since it happened―It is years since it happened.
彼が家出してから三年の星霜を経ている
Three years have elapsed since he left home―It is three years since he left home.
彼は三年を経て全快した
He recovered after three years had elapsed―after the lapse of three years―three years after.
日を経るに従って病が重くなった
He grew worse as the days went by―He grew worse and worse every day―He daily grew worse.
年月を経るに従って確信が固くなった
My conviction grew firmer as the years wore one―with the lapse of time.
ほど経て全快した
Some time after―It was some time before―I got well.

content:
へる〔減る〕
〈自動〉
1. (Numbers) decrease; (supplies) diminish; (hours) lessen; (possessions) dwindle; (the water) falls, gets low; (money) runs low; (customers) fall off; (one) loses (weight)

content.content: 数が六十に減った
The number has decreased to sixty.
四十(だけ)減った
The number has decreased by forty.
輸出が殖えて輸入が減る
The exports increase, and the imports diminish.
茶の輸出が減った、五割(だけ)減った
The exportation of tea has diminished―fallen (by) fifty percent.
あの国の人口が減る
The population of the country decreases―(と言うよりも)―The country decreases in population.
アイヌ人は人口が減るばかりだ
The Ainos go on decreasing in population.
病気して目方が減った、目方がだいぶ減った、目方が一貫目減った
Owing to my illness, I have lost (in) weight―lost much in weight―lost 10 pounds.
米を搗くと減る
There is a loss in cleaning rice.
一俵につき五升減る
There is a loss of 5 sho per bag.
井戸の水が減る
The well is getting low.
金が段々減る
The money is running low.
金は使えば減る
If you spend money, you will have less.
あの学校の生徒が減った
The students of that school have fallen off.

content: 2. (=磨り減る)to wear; wear away; wear off; wear out

content.content: 靴の底が厚いけれどはいているとじき減る
The soles are too thick, but they will soon wear off―wear away.
ゴムの靴は減らぬ
India-rubber shoes do not wear out.

content:
3. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 腹がへった
I am hungry―I feel hungry.
(そのうちに)腹がへってきた
I began to feel hungry―Hunger began to make itself felt.
腹がへると何でもうまい
“Hunger is the best sauce.”
女は口がへらぬ
A woman will have the last word.

a Belgian

a Persian

Persian

content.content: ペルシャ人
a Persian

Persian

the Shah of Persia

〈固名〉Berlin

content.content: ベロベロに酔っている
He is fuddled with drink―dead drunk.

ペロペロ

content.content: ペロペロなめる
to lick one's face―lap up milk

content.content: ペロリ食ってしまう
to lick the dish clean

to thrust out one's tongue

content:
へん〔変〕
〈名〉A change:(より)an accident; an emergency; a calamity; a disaster; a disturbance; a war; an affair

content.content: 万一の変に備える必要あり
We must provide against accidents―provide against emergencies.
維新の変
the War of the Restoration
西南の変
the Seinan Affair
機に臨み変に応ずる
to act according to circumstances―accommodate oneself to circumstances

content: 〈形〉Strange (appearance); odd (character); queer (sensation); peculiar (trait); singular (conduct, etc.)

content.content: はて変だ、この銃の不発は無いことだ
Strange! I never knew this gun miss fire.
その人の様子がはて変だなと思った
His appearance struck me as strange.
道理で様子が変だと思った
That accounts for the peculiarity of his appearance.
彼に初めて逢った時は変な男だと思った
The first time I met him, I thought him a strange man.
変なことがあればあるものだ
Strange things will happen!
こう言うと変に聞こえるが、しかし事実だ
It sounds strange,―Strange as it sounds,―it is a fact.
変なことを言うようだが俺は金持ち過ぎてかえってそのぜいたくができないのだ
Strange as it my sound, I am too rich to afford it.
あれは変な人物だ
He is an odd character.
君は変なことを言うね
You say queer things.
これを飲ませたら変な顔をした
He drank it, and made a queer face.
あの人は気が変になった
He is not in his right mind―out of his mind.
挙動が変だ
He behaves strangely.
言語挙動が変だから発狂したのかと思った
From his speech and behaviour, I concluded him to be mad.

content:
へん〔片〕
〈名〉A piece; a bit; a slice

content.content: 一片の紙
a piece of paper
一片の肉
a piece of meat―a slice of meat
一片の良心あらばそんなことはできまい
If he has a spark of conscience, he can not be able to do such a thing.
一片の同情あらば傍観はできまい
If he has a particle of sympathy, he can not remain an idle spectator.

content:
へん〔篇〕
〈名〉
1. (=巻)a volume; a book
2. (=書中の一部分)a chapter; a verse; a passage
3.

content.content: 一篇の詩
a poem―a verse―a copy of verses

content:
へん〔辺〕
〈名〉
1. (=近傍)(this or that) neighbourhood; (these or those) parts

content.content: 僕はこの辺は不案内だ
I am a stranger in these parts.
この辺に学校は無いか
Is there no school in this neighbourhood?
この辺は閑静だ
This is a quiet neighbourhood.
この辺はひなびている
This neighbourhood has a countrified air.
君はこの辺の地理に明るいようだね
You seem to know the neighbourhood well.
僕はこの辺は精しく(隅から隅まで)知っている
I know every inch of the neighbourhood.

content:
2. 
〈副詞、前置詞をもって表わす場合〉

content.content: あの人の家はどこかこの辺だ
He lives somewhere about here.
いや上野辺だ
No, he lives somewhere about Ueno.
火事はどの辺だ
Where is the fire?
浅草辺だ
It is somewhere about Asakusa.
なんでもあの辺らしい
It seems to be somewhere about there.
僕はこの辺は初めてだ
I have never been here before.
この辺に郵便局は無いか
Is there a post-office here?
この辺にそういう名前の人はいませんね
There is no person of that name who lives here.
(四十五六)まずその辺だろう
That's about it―That's about the size of it.
(先方の望みですか)その辺のところは判然しません
I can't say for certain about that.
その辺は西洋と日本はだいぶ違う
There is a great difference in that respect between Japan and the foreign countries.
その辺で切り上げてはどうだ
What do you say to putting an end to it there?
その辺で負けておいちゃどうだ
Won't you come down to that?

content: 4. (=三角、四角などの辺)a side (of a triangle, a quadrilateral, or a polygon)

へん〔遍〕
〈名〉(Number of) times

content.content: 何遍
How many times?―How often?
一二遍
one or two times―once or twice
五六遍
five or six times
何遍も何遍も
again and again―once and again―ever so many times
読書百遍義自ら通ず
Read a hundred times over, and the meaning will become clear of itself.

へん〔扁〕
〈名〉The radical (of a Chinese character)

content:
べん〔便〕
〈名〉
1. (=便利)convenience; facility; accommodation:(=なる) convenient, handy (for some purpose)

content.content: 公衆の便を図る
to consult the convenience of the public
公衆の便を図り開放す
The place is thrown open for the convenience of the public.
生徒の便を図り寄宿舎の設けあり
Dormitories are established to provide facility for the students―to give accommodation to the students.
本書は携帯に便なり
The book is convenient for carrying in one's pocket―handy to carry about with one―in a convenient form―in a light form.
湾内は水深くして船舶を容るるに便なり、大船を容るるに便なり
The bay is deep and suited for shipping―deep enough to accommodate large vessels.

content: 2. (=便宜)facilities

content.content: 彼の斡旋によって我々は多大の便を得た
His kind offices afforded us great facilities.

content: 3. (=何々の便)facilities (for something); available means (of doing something)

content.content: 交通の便
facilities for communication
そこは交通の便があるか
Does the place enjoy ［offer］ facilities for communication?
交通の便が無い
It lacks facilities for communication.
飛騨の国は交通の便が悪い
The province of Hida is poor in facilities for communication.
チベットは交通の便が絶無である
Thibet is cut off from communication with the outer world.
交通の便を図る、交通を便にする
to facilitate communication
旅行の便
facilities for travel―travelling facilities
日本は旅行の便が好い
Japan enjoys ［offers］ great travelling facilities.
支那は旅行の便が悪い
China is wanting in facilities for travel.
運送の便
facilities for transportation
運送の便があるか
Are there any facilities for transportation?―any available means of transportation?
水運の便がある
There are facilities for water-carriage―Water-carriage is available.
大阪は水運の便がある
Osaka enjoys ［offers］ great facilities for water-transport.
ここは船積の便がある
The place has shipping facilities.

content: 4. (=汽車や汽船の便)(railway or steamer) service

content.content: 汽車の便、鉄道の便
a railway service
そこは汽車の便があるか
Is there a railway service to the place?―Is the place convenient for the trains?―Can you get there by railway?
あいにく汽車の便が無い
It is a pity no railway service is available―The place is cut off from railway communication―You can't get there by train.
汽車の便がじきに開けます
A railway will be laid ［extended］ there very soon―The place will be brought into railway communication very soon―The trains will be running there very soon―There will be a railway there very soon.
鉄道の便がちかごろ開けました
A railway has been laid ［extended］ there―The place has been brought into railway communication.
汽船の便
a steamer service
その島に汽船の便があるか
Is there a steamer service to the island?―Can you get there by steamer?
汽船の便がちかごろ開けました
A steamer service has been opened ［established］.
もとは汽船の便がありませんでした
There used to be no steamer running to the island.
電車の便
an electric-car service
その学校は電車の便はどうですか
Is the school convenient for the cars?―Is the school (situated) near the car-line?―Can you get there by car?
電車の便はたいそうよろしい
It is very conveniently situated near the car-line.
電車の便が少し悪い
It is rather inconvenient for the cars-some way from the car-line.
電話の便
a telephone service
仙台は電話の便がありますか
Is there a telephone service in Sendai?―Does the city enjoy a telephone service?

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: この河は舟かじの便あり
The river is navigable.
飛行機の便を借りて蛮地に探検したら面白かろう
It would be delightful to explore savage lands by aeroplane.

content: 5. (=糞便)excrement; excreta; dejecta; faeces

content.content: 便を検査する
to examine the excreta

べん〔弁〕
〈名〉(花のは)a petal:(機械のは)a valve:(楽器のは)a ventil

content:
べん〔弁〕
〈名〉
1. (=弁舌)speech; eloquence; oratory

content.content: あの人は弁が好い
He speaks well―He is a good speaker―He is eloquent.
弁が悪い
He is poor speaker―He labours under a defect of speech.
江戸っ子は弁が軽い
Tokyo people are sprightly―vivacious.
弁を振るう
to put forth one's eloquence―exert one's oratorical powers―speechify―declaim―harangue―rant―spout―hold forth―make oneself heard
弁を弄す
to make words―make many words―(about anything)
弁を好む
to like to make words―like to make oneself heard
あえて弁を好むにあらず
Not that I like to make words―Not that I like to make myself heard.
あえて弁を好まんや
How can I but speak?―How can I help speaking?―How can I be silent?
弁を尽す
to exhaust one's eloquence―exhaust one's oratorical powers
弁を練る
to cultivate eloquence
懸河の弁
a flowing eloquence
堅白異同の弁
sophism

content: 2. (=どこ弁)a dialect; an accent

content.content: あの人は九州の弁だ
He speaks a Kyushu dialect―speaks with a Kyushu accent.
田舎弁だ
He speaks a rustic dialect―speaks with a provincial accent.
初めて東京へ来た時、田舎弁を笑われた
The first time I came to Tokyo, I was laughed at for my rustic dialect.

content:
べん〔鞭〕
〈名〉A whip

content.content: 鞭を加える
to whip one

content:
ペン
〈名〉A pen

content.content: ペンで書く
to write with a pen―write with pen and ink
ペンにインキを付ける
to dip one's pen in ink
ペン画
a pen-and-ink drawing
ペン先
a nib
ペン軸
a pen-holder
ペンは鋼でこしらえる
Pens are made of steel.
金ペン
a gold pen
鵞ペン
a quill pen

へんあい〔偏愛〕
〈名〉A partiality (for things Japanese, etc.)

べんい〔便意〕
〈名〉A desire to evacuate the bowels

content:
べんえき〔便益〕
〈名〉Convenience; benefit; advantage

content.content: 世の便益を図る
to consult the convenience of the public―look to the public benefit

content:
へんか〔変化〕
〈名〉
1. Change; variation; transformation; metamorphosis:(=する) to change, turn (into something―one thing into another); to vary, be varied; to transform, be transformed; to metamorphose, be metamorphosed

content.content: 変化を起こす、変化を来たす
to produce a change―work a change
物理的変化
physical change
化学的変化
chemical change
変化しやすき
changeable―variable

content: 2. (=Monotony に対し)variety; diversity; relief:(=ある) varied; diversified

content.content: この文章は変化かあって面白い
The style is varied.
変化のある文章
a varied style
この文章は変化が無くて面白くない
The style is dull and monotonous.
景色は変化があって面白い
The scenery is diversified.
変化のある景色
diversified scenery
変化の多い生涯
a checkered career
変化の無い単調な生活
jog-trot life―humdrum existence
こっけいな変化として価値がある
The comic comes in by way of relief.
変化は歓楽の元
“Variety is the mother of enjoyment.”

content: 3. ［文法］(名詞、代名詞の格の変化)declension:(動詞の変化)conjugation:(国語の語尾変化)inflection:(=する)(a noun) is declined; (a verb) is conjugated; (a language) is inflected

content.content: Latin や Greek は語尾変化が多い
Latin and Greek are highly inflected languages.

へんか〔返歌〕
〈名〉An answering couplet

content:
べんかい〔弁解〕
〈名〉Explanation; exculpation; an excuse; a plea; an apology:(=する) to explain (one's conduct); to exculpate oneself (from blame); to excuse oneself (from blame); to apologize (for a fault); to plead (poverty)

content.content: 弁解しても駄目だ(から止せ)
It is no use trying to excuse yourself.
そんな行為は弁解を許さぬ
Such actions admit of no excuse.
弁解するとかえっておかしい
Excuses will make the matter worse.
彼は(あんな事をして)何とか言って弁解したか
Did he explain his conduct?―Did he say anything in explanation of his conduct?
(そんな規則のあった事を)知らないと言って弁解している
He pleads ignorance.
貧乏だからと言って弁解している
He pleads poverty.

content:
へんかく〔変革〕
〈名〉A change

content.content: 大変革
a revolution

へんがく〔扁額〕
〈名〉A tablet (over the door)

べんがく〔勉学〕
〈名〉Study; pursuit of knowledge:(=する) to study; to pursue knowledge

へんかん〔変換〕
〈名〉Change:(=する) to change

へんかん〔返還〕
〈名〉Return; restoration; retrocession:(=する) to return, restore retrocede (anything to its owner)

べんき〔便器〕
〈名〉A chamber-stool (for invalids)

content:
べんぎ〔便宜〕
〈名〉
1. (=便利)convenience; accommodation:(=の) convenient (place, etc.)

content.content: 人の便宜を図る
to consult one's convenience―accommodate one
あの人は自分の便宜ばかり図っている
He always consults his own convenience―suits his own convenience.
旅人の便宜のために寺で宿屋をする
For the convenience of travellers,―To accommodate travellers,―the temple is used as a hotel.
この家は学校に近いという便宜がある
The house is at a convenient distance from the school―within easy distance of the school.
便宜の所に事務所を設ける
We shall have an office at a convenient place.
便宜のため、便宜上これを呼んで文法と言う
It is called grammar for convenience' sake.

content: 2. (=正義に対する便宜)expediency:(=の) expedient (plan, etc.)

content.content: 政治家は往々便宜のために正義を犠牲にする
A politician will sacrifice justice to expedience.
便宜の処置をとる
to take expedient measures
便宜主義
opportunism

content: 3. (=何々の便宜)facilities (for something)

content.content: 日本は旅行の便宜がある
Japan has facilities for travelling.
事業の便宜を与える
to afford one facilities for an undertaking
事を為す便宜を得る
to obtain facilities for doing something
氏の斡旋によって我々は多大の便宜を得た
His kind offices afforded us great facilities.

content: 4. (=便益)advantage:(=の) advantageous (position, etc.)

content.content: 日本は商業に便宜の好い位置を占めている
Japan holds an advantageous position for commerce.
鉄船は軽くて強いという二つの便宜がある
An iron ship has the double advantage of strength and lightness.

content:
ペンキ
〈名〉Paint

content.content: ペンキを塗る
to paint anything
この家はペンキを塗り替えなければならぬ
The house wants painting―(は英、米は)―needs painting.
ペンキ塗り立てご用心
Paint―Wet paint―Fresh paint.
ペンキ屋
a painter

へんきゃく〔返却〕
〈名〉Return; repayment:(=する) to return (a borrowed article); to pay, repay (money)

へんきょう〔偏狭〕
〈形〉Narrow-minded, intolerant (person); illiberal (views, etc.)
